Name: anthelios uv correct spf 70 daily face sunscreen with niacinamide
comments:
* I have to use another sunscreen under this to get near my eyes and mouth. If I get anywhere near my eyes it somehow will work it's way into them. I keep it because it's a high SPF, doesn't look awful on the skin, absorbs well, and has a nice texture. 
But boy does it sting. I try to only put it up near my hairline on my forehead and slightly below my cheeks bones to keep it away from my eyes. Then I thoroughly wash my hands just in case. 
I also keep it away from my lips at all costs because it's got a lingering taste * Even if I don't rub the moisturizer around my eyes it still stings!! It doesn't soak into the skin and as the day goes rhe product starts to melt into my eyes and lips. It tastes soooo bad. * Wanted to love this so much! Not impressed :/ it has a wonderful texture, blends in smoothly, and leaves no whitecast! However it stings your eyes like crazy and kind of just sits on your skin making you look and greasy for the whole day. Was genuinely expecting a more elegant wear experience especially for the price. * Do NOT put this around your eyes. It stings worse than anyrhing i could imagine. My eyes are still so swollen. I had to pull over and rinse them out with a water bottle and they still wouldnt stop burning!! I wanted to love this product. It has a really nice texture and goes on smoothly, but this sort of eye sting is unacceptable. * It leaves my face greasy for the rest of the day and makes my makeup seem to 'sweat' off when I wear it. I'll be using up the bottle but for my body when I'm in the sun this summer. * I really like how it is not greasy and does not leave a white cast. I thought I found my go-to SPF, but I got red bumps on my forehead, and they were gone when I stopped using it. It might not be suitable for acne-prone and oily skin. * Wore it to go on a walk outside a few weeks ago, and it eventually got to my eyes it burned so bad. Really irritates eyes…the purpose of sunblock to avoid sun damage is to also apply it on eyelids or around eye area. Avoid applying around the eye area & thoroughly was your hands after applying if you buy this.

Name: anthelios ultra light fluid face sunscreen spf 60
classic whip spf 30 sunscreen mousse
comments: * I love this products packaging, so much so I decided to cheat on my SuperGoop sunscreen to try it. Unfortunately, the fragrance, though pleasant, is a little too strong and ideally, products that go on your face should not have fragrance. Also, over time it will run in your eyes and every time I use it, it stings my eyeballs. It makes your skin super glowy, but if youre a oily girlie like me, it will, after a few hours of wear, make you look GREASY. So if you dont have sensitive skin and if you have drier skin this is the product for you. If your skin reacts to fragrance or if you have oily/combo skin, I'd reach for something else. * While its cute and protects nicely from the sun, it burns my eyes. * The whipped consistency makes application a breeze. Only need a quick squeeze and you can cover pretty much your whole body! Will buy again once I run out. Smells great! * My 5year old now LOVES wearing sunscreen. Everytime we go to the pool or the beach she wants the whip. We are very fair skinned, but no one has gotten even the slightest bit pink all summer because this stuff is just too fun to wear and reapply! * I really wanted to like this and got 2 bottles because I run out of sun screen fast but first it stung my eyes everytime i used it and although it smells good, it has a distinct scent of acetone or something and it doesn't really go away. I haven't broken more than usual but it has been making anything plastic (like sunglasses, make up palettes, everything) melt or turn them very brittle because of the harsh chemical. * I just knew i had gotten the right product.  Unfortunately within 30 mins on i had to run and shower it off.  The beautiful shine turned WHITE on my dark skin. * I love the smell and texture of this product, but it caused me to develop an awful case of contact dermatitis that lasted 2 weeks. Fortunately I tested it only on my forearms. Definitely patch test this product before applying it all over your body.

Name: anthelios melt-in milk body & face sunscreen lotion spf 100
comments:

Do not put it in the orbit of your eye (under your brow/under your eye), because it burns so bad if you rub your eye or do soemthing to get it in your eye. I had to use the eye wash station at school because my eyes were uncontrollably crying from how bad it burns. Overall though i really like this product because it gets the job done, feels lightweight, doesnt make me break out, and doesnt make me look white * I ABSOLUTELY LOVE LOVE LOVE this sunscreen. Name: mineral mattescreen spf 40
comments: * I bought this particular item because it rated well on ewg. The texture is mousse like and blends in easily. Its tinted so it doesnt leave a white residue. It feels kind of like a primer, and it did great under my makeup. I cant speak to its effectiveness at sun protection yet but it looks promising. * I like this sunscreen and I really enjoy how it feels on my skin. It does stop a lot of oil from resurfacing on my skin throughout the day which is a plus. But it does leave an obvious white cast on my skin and takes roughly 5 minutes more or less of continously rubbing it into my skin for it to go away. I'm considering returning it, just on this alone but my skin is really enjoying the matte feel and oil control. * I have tried literally everything under the sun to keep me from getting shiny. I periodically apply powder during the day to keep my shine down. I started using the regular super goop last year. Loved it but didn't control my shine. Decided to try this and I'VE NEVER BEEN MORE PLEASED! Whatever which craft this is, i'm a lifetime fan. When I use this…. I don't even need powder, like the entire day! After a few hours I'll check the mirror, no shine! It's fantastic! I wish it was more affordable and bigger bottle… but it does last forever. A pea size amount is all that is needed. I wear my makeup over it. Has not broke me out or caused any issues. It's truly a fantastic product and an absolute must have if you tend to be oily or shiny! * The white cast was surprising because i read so many reviews. I do love how matte this sunscreen is but i will definitely be returning. * This is amazing.  Sunscreen and primer and a tint but no shimmer.  Keeps the shine down. Remember to shake the tube before applying.  Expensive but takes the place of a couple of products. * I purchased this based on a suggestion from my eyelash extension gal. I originally got Bliss facial sunscreen and it closed my fans and would break down the eyelash adhesive. Changed to this (any mineral sunscreen will do) and I love it * I love this stuff! Higher SPF, natural ingrediants that are safer for the ocean. It is slightly tinted and hide my pigmentation scars-ish just enough. Its soft and best of all, I never break out! My daughter (15) uses it and it does not burn under her eyes, and even the sensitive stuff burns her. We arw a FL fam 7 min away from the beach.

Name: anthelios melt-in milk body and face sunscreen spf 60

There are other sunscreens that I prefer that don't have an unpleasant scent that I prefer, but overall this is a solid sunscreen. * I like the way I apply the sunscreen and it doesn't leave any white cast nor does it leave the skin greasy * I used to use this years ago and liked it well enough. I don't know if they changed ingredients, but I will be returning this one, unfortunately. * It blends into my skin smoothly. Many sunscreens test way below the spf on the package. I wish this had a screw top. It would be easier to get out more of the product.

Name: hello sunshine invisible sunscreen for face spf 50

It's the only thing i want to use to prime my face now. I am a medium to full coverage girlie and this wears so freaking beautifully under my foundation. It makes everything look so radiant but not greasy! The photo attached is with the product on my face before foundation. This product was also sent to me in PR but there is no obligation to review it, i just think everyone needs to know how amazing it is lol * I have not yet tried it on make up but i put this on when I go out the house instead of normal sunscreen that smells * Bought this on a whim when I saw it by the checkout in Ulta. I had been on the hunt for a hydrating sunscreen. I was experiencing extremely dry skin with dermatitis. All of my sunscreens and makeup were irritating my skin more and looked terrible over the dry patches, no matter how hydrating they claimed to be. I had tried tons of expensive skin care, none of which was working. I don't know how, but wearing this for just three days under makeup totally transformed my dry skin. I'm not even using any other skin care right now, and my skin is the healthiest it's ever been. It also wears great under makeup if you have dry skin. If you have oily skin, steer clear. Dry skin girlies, this is your new holy grail!

Name: clear sunscreen stick spf 50+

I have noticed that this gets into my eyes ONLY at the very very very end of the day (like 10+ hours), likely due to my oily eyelids haha — throughout the day, there is no stinging! The only con I could note is the high price; I wish sunscreens like this were more accessible for everyone as it helps protect from skin cancer. * This product gave me red bumpy skin. comments:
* I am loving COOLA right now. This SPF is perfect for this dreadful Texas humidity and heat. It's very lightweight, non-greasy, and has a pleasant scent. Name: anthelios mineral tinted ultra light face sunscreen fluid spf 50
anthelios body and face soft finish mineral sunscreen lotion spf 50
comments:
* Feels good on the skin and especially sensitive skin. Plus this brand has a lot of great products. But the white cast is absolutely insane. After applying to my arms, chest and face I looked like a sickly victorian child. I will probably just use this for my small children this summer so I dont waste it. * Bought this for vacation after reading a few reviews. Have started to lean towards mineral sunscreen vs. chemical. It does a good job protecting however I felt it was drying and chalk like on the skin. Overall it was just ok. Personally I wouldn't rebuy * My partner developed an allergy to chemical sunscreen and finding a mineral sunscreen he likes has been really difficult. This sunscreen works great for him, provides full sun protection for at least a couple of hours and doesn't leave him with breakouts. Definitely recommend this sunscreen if you're limited to mineral sunscreen. * Product is basically clown makeup. Use even a teapsoon and your face has a huge white cast. As someone who resmebles casper the ghost in the complexion departemmt, I was susprised this spf made me even lighter. For those with darker skin tones, I would run away. Product is thick, difficult to apply, and greasy. After a while, it ends up drying your skin and is a whole lot of NOPE. * I liked it but at the same time I didn't. It leaves me white cast and takes time to absorb. I wouldn't recommend if you have mixed skin, it leaves oily sensation. * This is definitely a good sunscreen for those who are sensitive skinned or have problems with chemical sunscreens. I bought this after a long battle with dermatitis and it hasnt caused a flare like most others, but it does leave a HORRENDOUS white cast. I look like Casper the friendly ghost, and if i stand next to a white wall i could close my eyes and match it.
I do this this is an effective sunscreen that would not irritate sensitive skin types, but you will have a white cast no matter how hard you try to work it in, so be ready. * I used this product for a week before writing this review, but my final thoughts were the same as the first ones I had, if not worse. First of all, I wear the second lightest shade of foundation and this sunscreen had a HORRIBLE white cast that barely went away after hours of wear. It didn't massage in well either. I had to pat it in in segments so it wouldnt pull at my skin because it was so thick and drying. I haven't had problems with dry skin in 6 years but this product made my face and neck flakey! Even after double cleansing, exfoliating, and extra moisturizing, I was flakey and the white cast pilled on my skin. I'm so disappointed because I heard this brand was supposed to be great, and this product is not cheap. The pros would be that it didn't sting my eyes and you get a lot of product in one bottle. 
TLDR; I had to return this because of how bad the white cast and dryness was.

Name: travel size play everyday lotion spf 50

* I have to use another sunscreen under this to get near my eyes and mouth. If I get anywhere near my eyes it somehow will work it's way into them. I keep it because it's a high SPF, doesn't look awful on the skin, absorbs well, and has a nice texture. 
But boy does it sting. I try to only put it up near my hairline on my forehead and slightly below my cheeks bones to keep it away from my eyes. Then I thoroughly wash my hands just in case.

Name: purescreen+ tinted mineral sunscreen
comments:
* this oily soup of a sunscreen should not be appearing in the "CC cream" or other searches for ulta. to say it's tinted is a farse, it is slightly in appearance to be non-white. it is also the oiliest, runniest cosmetic I have ever encountered. I have dry skin and couldn't even absorb it after many attempts at blending (which then eliminated any coverage it provided). the end feel was disgusting and greasy and it gave acne within 24 hours. also, the packaging doesn't seal well. in just one day it seeped out into my makeup bag. I recommend it to everyone with dark skin because not only is it an effective sunscreen, it also looks like a light foundation layer. I wear it when I have photoshoots and it looks great, my makeup artist agrees!

I won't repurchase this & I'm really glad I didn't pay full price. * felt terrible on my skin and it brought of my imperfections * I would strongly suggest looking elsewhere for an SPF.

Name: sensitive mineral sunscreen spray spf 50+
comments: * I love Blue Lizard's other products, but the spray nozzle stopped working only after a couple of sprays. * Sirays on so easy. Applies with minimal effort to rub in after spraying on. Highly recommened this product. * I bought this for a trip to Maui with my husband. The bottle looks to be a decent size - a little smaller than your average spray sunscreen container. The product itself worked well. There was a slight white cast but it wasn't bad. It felt like it was stuck to our skin (in a good way) and definitely protected us from the sun. HOWEVER... Good thing that was all we needed for our trip, but that's DEFINITELY not worth the money. Such a bummer!

Name: self reflect probiotic moisturizing sunscreen spf 32
comments:
* I love this sunscreen! It is one of the only ones I've tried that doesn't break me out. I have normal, but dehydrated skin that is fairly sensitive and acne prone. The zinc oxide in this sunscreen really helps calm redness and irritation in my skin and is somewhat hydrating whereas some sunscreens I've tried for acne prone skin were too drying for me. I used this for years and decided to try other sunscreens, but I ended up coming back to this one as others i tried just didnt compare. * It leaves a dewy sheen, has a pleasant smell, and did not break me out. For me, it was just too thick feeling on my skin, so I will be returning. But, I really do get why it's popular. * I have been using this sunscreen for a while (probably almost 2 years). I do mix in a little bit of tinted sunscreen from another brand, but can wear this on its own. The best things about this sunscreen are that it wears well under makeup and it provides amazing protection. My make up lasts just as long with this underneath, and does not change the finish. Sometimes I feel like it makes it look better. 

The protection on this is phenomenal. I went to an all day concert this weekend, and used this with my holy grail foundation that lasts through almost anything and for over 15 hours. I forgot to put sunscreen on my arms for the first hour, and got a little red even though I put sunscreen on pretty early. However, my face was not burned AT ALL, and I was in the sun a lot. 

I dont usually wear this one on its own, I usually wear a more tinted one if I am not wearing makeup, but this is my favorite sunscreen under make up, hands down, and the highest % protection out of any of my other sunscreens. Highly recommend! * I have been trying so many different sunscreens and so many i havent liked. The kinship is amazing and its great for dry skin. Works well with the vitimin C serum im uaong. I will definitely repurchase * I have tried so many sunscreens for the face. A lot of them are nice, but eventually break me out. The ones that don't make my eyes water, and make me look very oily. This sunscreen looks very nice on the face. It evens out my skin tone a bit, and moisturizes. It can be a little tacky, but the finish looks so nice, I don't mind. Some days I use a light hand and dust some setting powder over top. This gives a nice glow, while letting your natural skin tone shine through. Definitely give us a try. * This is my holy grail.  22.4% NON-NANO zinc and NO butyloctyl salicylate?  Amazing.  I have very sensitive skin, and the light vanilla fragrance doesn't bother my skin, but watch out for that if you are sensitive to fragrance. * I loved it

The beige shade is touch light and a touch on the pink side. But once i put bronzer and blush it evens out. Name: clear sunscreen stick spf 50+
comments:
* This stuff is amazing. I have very fair skin that burns almost instantly. I recently used it on a disneyland trip and didnt get any sun burns! 
This morning i was doing yard work and grabbed for the stick but i was rushing snd i couldnt get an even layer on my shoulders (totally my fault its hard for me to reach entirely) and you can completely tell where i applied the stick and where i missed it (again my fault). This stuff is legit and is not greasy or sticky. * One of the only spfs I've tried that actually works and doesn't break me out. It's a little oily but once it settles into the skin that goes away. * I was really excited to use this for my face, especially when I have make up on. However I realized it was too greasy for my skin and though it didn't ruin my makeup if I applied on top, it did not sit well. My face would just feel oily all day. Now I just apply on my arms and legs and it's really nice because I dont have to get it all on my hands. * So easy to apply, it doesn't disturb my makeup when reapplying. The only tip
I give is to powder on top of it so your face doesn't look so greasy. This is the perfect spf. * An absolute staple! I have very acne-prone, oily, and reactive skin for reference, and LOVE this sunscreen! I garden a lot in the spring/summer, and its so nice to be able to reapply sunscreen without using your hands directly. Have used this for months with no breakouts. I have noticed that this gets into my eyes ONLY at the very very very end of the day (like 10+ hours), likely due to my oily eyelids haha — throughout the day, there is no stinging! The only con I could note is the high price; I wish sunscreens like this were more accessible for everyone as it helps protect from skin cancer. * This product gave me red bumpy skin. The first time I used it I thought something else caused it becuase I also tried new makeup that day. I tried again with no makeup and had the same thing happen. Horrible. I had prefectly clear skin and its been 5 days and my face hasnt gone back to normal. I do have sensitive skin, but thats why I bought a pricier product… * Its pricey but for me very worth it. I work in outdoors and I use this sunscreen every single day. I have very sensitive skin, and it has not given me acne or allergies and its not dried out my skin. I highly recommend for all of us that are constantly in the sun. Also highly sweat and water resistant.

Name: peach blossom classic body organic sunscreen spray spf 70

No weird smell, It does leave a slight tint on the skin, just looks like a tan. Would 100% buy again * I really like this formula. It covers well and it's fragrant but not too heavy or greasy. It did pretty well in the water too. * I don't get much sun exposure because I like to stay indoors mostly, BUT I use this still to keep my skin young! Doesn't at all leave a greasy or sticky residue and rubs in really easily! I will say careful when spraying if you have tile or wood floors cause it'll be slippery at first but it honestly dries up pretty quickly * This stuff is way too expensive, for toxin-filled sunscreen. As a sunscreen, it doesn't really work well, anyway. You definitely can't just spray it on and go. You have to be sure to soak yourself with the spray and then slather it on VERY WELL.  Otherwise, you'll be lookin like a zebra. It's ridiculous. Never seen a sunscreen so finicky before. The smell is horribly chemically and not good for the lungs to breathe, so hold your breath, while spraying!  Also, it is gone after about 2 uses!!!!! Crazy! That is for using it on a 10 y/o body, at that! Wouldn't last an adult's body but maybe one use! Will never purchase again! * I don't know how people can say this isn't greasy. Maybe "shiny" & greasy are different things to people, but this appears very oily on the skin, almost as if it doesn't evaporate all the way. My main problem with this sunscreen, however, is that it stained my green shirts, and it did not come out in the wash! I could even see oily yellow residue on the nozzle after I closed it, so I know it's greasy and has a color to it. Yea the sunscreen works (but I think most do), and I think the smell is actually nice, but I can't recommend it if it's going to ruin your clothes. I would take white residue on skin over yellow grease stains on clothes any day.

Name: hydrating sheer sunscreen face and body lotion with spf 30
comments: * Tried this on recommendation. Ugh. Leaves a white cast and is basically pointless in blocking the sun. Burned the first time using it. I had been using La Roche Posay and it had prevented burns, but this did nothing to prevent the sun. All the work I've done on my skin over the winter is now for naught. * This is my all time favorite sunscreen it is my go to last step of my morning skincare rountine. I worked with all my makeup products with making my skin feel heavy. Very hydrating i use it on my face neck and tattoos. I have very sensitive combo skin w rosacea and this product works great for me! * I was introduced to this specific sunscreen because I received some small samples. They convinced me to buy the full sized bottle! Its lightweight and melts into the skin quickly. Even my husband noticed how it didnt leave a white cast on him and appreciated how moisturizing the sunscreen is. We even apply it to our faces without issue. I think this will be our go-to sunscreen from now on! * I wanted to love this sunscreen because it didn't feel greasy or sticky after applying. However, I quickly learned that when you start to sweat, it doesn't stay. Ended up getting in my car with black leather seats after a few hours at a baseball game and didn't think anything of it until I got home and realized I had two white casts from where my legs had rested. It transferred to the leather and took a while to remove the stain. * I didn't initially buy this to use as my daily facial sunscreen, but I ran out of my usual moisterizer with SPF and have been using this instead. I really like the texture to apply under make up and it has not caused any acne or clogged pores, which I am usually prone to! I am going to repurchase for daily use going into summer, and I am curious to see how it holds up with more humid weather and sweat. * I'm really conflicted on how I feel about this product. I do adore the initial thin, liquidy texture of this product. And I love how moisturizing, yet lightweight the product feels upon application and setting. But it has a few problems. I'm pretty fair, and this sunscreen still leaves a VERY noticeable white/pink cast on my skin. It doesn't set into beard hair well at all either. It will color dark hairs white. And when I sweat, even a little bit, it starts running EVERYWHERE. It legitimately looks like I'm melting when wearing this. 😩 Great texture, application, and finish on the product overall. But it runs with slight sweating and the white cast is very obvious. * This sunscreen is very runny and liquidy. I find it doesn't blend that good into the face. It's very hydrating. I think I would prefer to use it on my body.

Then once it got so bad when I was on a plane mid-flight and my skin started to swell on my neck and face. I could barely open my eyes. It was frightening! I have no idea what in this did it, but beware. * I was using this spf for a while but I started noticing that my skin started to look red and my neck was all itchy. Then I went back to check reviews and I see I'm not the only. I will not buy this again. * This is a staple for me! I love that it feels lightweight, it blends in easily and it doesn't leave my skin smelling like sunscreen all day! This is my current favorite sunscreen rn and I truly like it more than a lot of high end sunscreens! I love to recommend this to friends and family bc I feel like it's a hidden gem that doesn't deserve enough love! * I was suprised to read the comments on this and see all of the negative ines. For me this is the perfect sunscreen. The perfect texture, easy to apply and no white cast. Leaves your skin glowy but not greasy at all, extremely lightweight but still moisturizing. I dont wear any makeup on top of it though so I cant speak to that, but I am a pale redhead and it has worked great for me all summer! * I don't usually put reviews but everyone's hating on this sunscreen. i don't use it under makeup but I've been using it every day and it feels nice and hydrating. i have acne prone sensitive skin but it hasn't irritated me. i have an olive complexion and if i rub it in enough it doesn't leave a white cast. i think it's pretty good for the price. i guess everyones skin has a different reaction to different ingredients so you just have to find what works for you

Name: glow oil spf 50 dry body oil sunscreen
comments:
* The first few words on the back of this bottle are "clean chemical sunscreen actives" but this isnt a clean product if that's what you're looking for.

7 of the main ingredients come up as hazardous or harmful when it's scanned into the Yuka app. Octocrylene is an endocrine disruptor and once broken down it becomes carcinogenic, studies have found. Just an FYI this isnt exactly "clean".

It's also a bit greasy, you'll need to wash your hands after using it before toughing your hair or face. * Because the oil lays on thick, I think it takes a long time for it to settle in the skin, so it's easy to come off. I kept reapplying, but whenever I would switch sides tanning, I felt my skin burning. The oil probably rubbed off on my towel, and I ended up burnt. I should have gone with a spray since I think it absorbs in the skin faster since it's a lighter coat so to speak.

It seems to be that you can't sit or lay down for 20 minutes while it's being absorbed since it's really easy for it to come off. * I applied and reapplied and reapplied and i am so burnt after being at the beach for jusr a few hours that you would think I never applied any sunblock at all. My skin hurts and is radiating heat. My friend and i both feel like the oil was amplifying the sun rather than blocking it. She isnt red because she has more naturally occurring melanin than i do, but her skin is painful and tight as well. I wanted to love it like i do the rest of their products I've tried, but instead I'll be going back to normal sunblock. * I was so happy I found an oil with spf as I usually use coco oil but wanted something with better protection for vacation. I wore this for hours bathing in the sun and didnt burn one bit. HOWEVER, my skin erupted in tiny little bumps all over. My body skin is not sensitive and I was extremely surprised and disappointed since Supergoop is so well trusted. It took days to have the bumps go away and in certain areas i can still feel them and its been over a week. Would not recommend as it is highly irritating. * as a person who uses body oil over body lotion daily, and who has consistent problems with product pilling, I love this.  It sits on top of my other skincare without interacting.  it's a little pricey but worth it, since I cannot seem to find a similar product made by a drugstore brand.  if there was, I would buy it.

I don't use it on my face because facial oil makes my glasses fall off, but I don't see why you couldn't * Felt very greasy on skin.  And broke out. I will buy this again.  Will look into a different brand.  It isnt worth the price either. * This glow oil is insaneeely good! It glides onto the skin and looks so natural just that glow from within. I love that it doesn't need feel sticky either. Obsessed! Grateful to be gifted by supergoop.

Name: spf 30 baby oil
comments: * Tried it and it doesnt work, maybe for a short period of time but i wore it on a float trip and it didnt do any protecting, i reapplied multiple times but if its not water resistant being an oil whats the point in it. I guess use it if you just wanna lay out maybe but i wouldnt but again * I got this as a gift with purchse of their Classic Whip sunscreen. Wow, the smell of this is so nice! It definitely has a baby smell, so if you're not looking for that typical coconut, pineapple, etc this may be for you. It reminds me of the classic Love's Baby Soft fragrance from the 80's. This entire brand seems to capture these throwback products really well! Kudos for that! I wish there was a larger size option, but I'll definitely purchase a full size bottle. * Be sure to look at the fluid ounces before buying.  This is about the size of a cell phone.  I was expecting at least a standard size bottle. I feel stupid.  Smells good but not a good value. I've not used in sun yet.  Gotta save for a special occasion since it will last a whole 3 minutes. * I was hoping this would smell like the Vacation perfume but it smells like 1975 baby powder.  So strongly!! Amd the bottle is horribly leaky.  I picked up curbside from the store and by the time i was home the inside of the bag was so greasy. * obsessed with the packaging and smell of this one! and im so glad it includes good spf unlike actual baby oil. only taking 1 star off because the bottle leaks like crazy so if you travel you can lose quite a bit of it… * found this product on sale. tried it out, felt amazing, smells great, so silky and smooth. I went back ordered 2 more and their face spray, which I recommended as well! * Absolutely not safe for time in the sun. I got burned right throufh it. Might be ok for daily wear, like a work commute.

Name: ultra sheer face serum spf 60+
comments:
* I so wish I would have read the reviews before purchasing this! I did not but it to use under makeup but there's no way I could. Using 2 fingers; the amount recommended by dermatologists, my face was GREASY!! Also burned my eyes, as many others have stated. 
I' plan to return it. I can't see! It coats your eyes! * I frequently use neutrogena products and almost exclusivly use thier sun protection products. However, when i tried this i had an AWFUL reaction. It had such an intense reaction with my eyes, they were hurting and red for over a week after using this product once. When a friend had the same reaction, i looked into it, and this product is known to cause this reaction. Do not purchace. 

I will continue to buy and use the other Neuterogena Sunscreens - just never this one. * The only Spf I continue to buy. However it does burn your eyes if it gets into them. I try my best not to touch my face after applying to avoid it. * For the first couple weeks of using this product i enjoyed it thoroughly, other than the fact that it irritates eyes. I got around it by avoiding the eye contour area during application. As of late my skin has been reacting poorly to this product, my skin feels dry within a couple hours of application and I have developed a mild rash around my nose and lips (the most sensitive areas on my face). I really wanted to love it, but I will have to get rid of it. * Love the texture and it applies easy but somehow this always migrates to my eyes and burns. * Love this sunscreen! It's lightweight, non-greasy, and a perfect primer for makeup. I used it on my Florida trip recently and it protected me from sunburns. Recommend! * I use many Neutrogena products with no issues, but I have used this one 3x in different months already, and every time I did so I got acne forming on my forehead. I've read others' recent reviews as well, and wish I had seen it earlier, because it also got into my eyes throughout the day and it hurt bad.

Name: force shield superlight sunscreen broad spectrum spf 30
comments:
* I've been using this for 4+ years starting in July 2021. I have not used another sunscreen since. I am a brown skinned girl, and this has worked WONDERS for my skin. I have not had a bad breakout since I started using this. I use this EVERYDAY. one pump is all you need, after I use any water based or oil free based moisturiser. Reccommend it to everyone I know!!! * I really like this sunscreen so far, no white cast, and dries more matte than most of my other mineral sunscreens (but I also didn't find it too drying, and I have pretty dry skin). My main criticism is the packaging. Because it has a pump dispenser, I want to hold it upright, but I don't think there's a straw in it, so to get anything to come out I actually have to hold it pointed down. And there's just far too much plastic in general for a pretty dumb design. All it needs is a screw cap and a hole you squeeze out of. Fix that and it'd be great. * I got a sample size for a trip to the Keys and was on a boat for a few hours and it worked wonders! I did not burn at all on my face ans ended up with a beautiful tan! I also was snorkeling as well and still no burn! Haven't tried it with makeup yet, but as a sunscreen for a day on the water it was great! Just always remember to reapply if you will be out for a while! * Lightweight, breathable, slightly green tinted (but doesn't show on skin) sunscreen. Works well as I use this on my face every day multiple times a day * I was on the market for a moisturizer that offered redness correction and was excited when this product came up in my search.

Unfortunately, this product just was not working for me. If applied to freshly clean skin, it worked fine, but if I had toner on, the moisturizer would start pilling. 

After a few hours of wear, my skin texture looked terrible and left my skin looking dried out. * So i've been officially using this sun screen for a week and i really do love it for my acne prone skin. It also has a really nice scent to it like pistachios lol. Absorbs fast and doesn't feel greasy! i do have a lot of texture on my chin and a lot of acne scars/ so i experienced some pilling there but thats super minor and the only con about this sunscreen for me. Otherwise i had no new breakouts caused, and i will be repurchasing! * I did a lot of research before buying this on sale. The last facial sunscreen I tried burned my face. I still don't know what did it, as the individual ingrediants were all in other products I use. Anyways, I tried this. I'm not outside much, but wanted to anticipate the summer heat/humidity. I needed something ok for combo skin with acne (humidity makes my acne worse), yet also ok for skin that had damage/rosacea. This has been wonderful! I patch tested first. It's really helped keep my skin from being too oily and shiny. No white cast (light skintone), no reactions. I'm Autistic and super sensitive to smell, and I don't smell anything from it when applying. I store my container upside down— plastic top down in the box, and I have had no issues with the pump. It's quit tidy and easy. The only drawbacks that I've observed from it, is that it can be drying on the dryer parts of my skin. What I do is spray some kind of moisterizer spritz on my face like Rosewater toner, moisterizing toner, etc. Do this just after applying the sunscreen, and as needed throughout the day if you feel dry. I'm sure you could also put moisterizer over it, as it dries down well. It also could pill if you put it over skincare without letting the skincare absorb first. Give it 10-15 minutes between moisterizer and sunscreen. No pilling when I switched to doing that. So the drawbacks are easy enough to overcome. I do think it has helped with my acne too. Cannot attest for how it looks under face makeup, as I do not wear foundation.

Name: plus one tinted daily mineral sunscreen broad spectrum spf 40
comments:
* When using the recommended 2-4 pumps, this sunscreen is too dark on me and very greasy. It's a shame because I love Bubble and I was hoping this could be a sunscreen I could wear without makeup. * I have tried most spf that are available to buy in store and this is one of my favorites far.
If you are looking for 
-dewy
-lightly tinted 
-mineral 
You will love ! I am acne prone and prefer mineral and i love this one great mineral protection and it does not pill under makeup. On my 3rd bottle ! * I wanted something lightweight to wear everyday underneath my makeup but this sunscreen is thick and doesn't settle into the skin as nicely as i was hoping for. I used this product before a workout and it burned my skin as i started to sweat. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone with dry and/or sensitive skin. Bummed because i was super excited to try this brand! * This is the best thing that Bubble has made probably so far!!🫶🏻 I use it every single day!! * I am caucasian, ok? Like, Scandanavian. I am from The Netherlands. I got this because of the reviews and I was hoping it would give a little tint so that I don't have to wear makeup all the time. Some reviews said that the company should offer color selection, but it's unnecessary. I'm glad I looked at the pictures, which show someone rubbing it in, and it seems to be dissolving into their skin and skintone. That's exactly what it does. Do not be alarmed when you put this on your hands and you think it's too orange. It's not. After you gently rub it in all over your face and neck, it kind of smoothes out and works with your natural skin tone. It really evens my face and rest of my body out, without looking like I have anything on. 

I was almost afraid and threw it out, but I'm glad I gave it two more tries. Several people have told me my skin is glowing and I look good since I got this stuff. It does take a second to fall into the skin, but my makeup looks excellent and glowing on top! * I have ohrchaser 4-5 dofferenr "highly-rated" face sunscreens for my face but they have all disappointed me. This one feels perfect! Not too heavy or sticky and doesn't clog my pores or causes breakouts. The light tint is not noticeable and my skin looks so even toned. * This blended easily with no cast. I let it sit on bare skin for 15 min, went outside and my face felt hotter than any where else. Not a good start. I then applied my skin like, self setting foundation and 20 min later it's still tacky and looks to be sitting semi heavily on top. My normal products that set beautifully all lifted anything underneath when used with this. Used by itself it was a satin finish but 0 coverage that did not fully dry down. I used about a pump and a half for my face and neck. I have dry/normal skin.  I will try it with other base items but will most likely return.

Name: sun shield on-the-glow sheer stick sunscreen spf 40
comments: * Great spf for travel or beach/pool days. Leaves skin dewy and sparkly and absorbs pretty well and has a nice scent… So, listen to the reviews! It does has large chunks of glitter flakes. It will be noticeable on the skin. However, I've been using this for the past few days on my face and I like it. Be careful applying to close to the eye area because it can burn… Has a nice light tropical scent. * This stuff is so pretty on the skin and effective! This is part of my daily routine. I put it on mu chest / arms and its very comfortable and long lasting. I wore it out in the pool for 2+ hours (im very very fair skinned) and i did not burn. This product gives me the perfect glow. Due to the heavy oils and glitter, i would not put this on my face, but it's beautiful elsewhere. * not greasy, not too glowy, feels lightweight, overall great product! but that glitter is pretty big AND it sticks a lot - even after a shower it was still there, so just be aware if that bothers you! * I use this as a cute little add on after my thicker SPF creams. The glitter adds a cute glow and its perfect for reapplying throughout the day. * I saw this originally on Kopari's page and was SO excited to try it! It truly is the perfect on-go must have! I love that it keeps my skin protected with the right amount of subtle glow. I am taking this everywhere with me! * I'm a huge fan of Kopari's sun products and this stick lived up to all expectations! After the first application, the glow is much more even and leaves such a beautiful, natural highlight. The stick format makes it super easy to apply and I can't wait to use this stick throughout the warmer months! * I got this as soon as it came out, I'm really excited to wear it this summer! The first application, there were some big sparkles, but once I swiped it a few more times, it applied evenly. I like the highlight and sunscreen in one of this product.

Name: classic body organic sunscreen lotion spf 50 fragrance free
comments:
* I was hesitant to try this because of some of the negative reviews, especially the reviews that mention a bad smell; however, I'm happy to report that mine has ZERO smell. It has a fairly lightweight consistency and blends onto the skin seamlessly. There is a slight tacky feel, and I noticed that when I rested my elbows on surfaces in my car, a grease spot was left behind - this is the reason I took off 1 star. Yet overall, this is a nice product that I'd definitely recommend. I also appreciate the fact that it's free of coconut oil! * This is my go-to for my tattoos and I've been using it for about 3 or 4 years now. There is no white cast, and it makes my tattoos (all black and gray) pop! I can truly attest to the sun protection, as once I missed a spot and could see a very clear, visible pink patch with a hard line differentiating from where the protection was! I also use this on my daughter who has sensitive skin and eczema, and it seems to be going okay. 

Fragrance-free means no added frangrance—so it smells like a natural sunscreen, which I don't mind. But I see some people complaining about that…

If you're looking for excellent sun protection, especially for tattoos, I HIGHLY recommend this product! * Dries quickly and invisible on skin. Leaves a somewhat velvety texture, but feels very light and not sticky. Good amount of product for the price. I had high hopes due to positive reviews about no cast and fragrance-free (I'm very sensitive to scents). I have to wear/reapply sunscreen a lot for medical reasons, so I'm very picky and this one checks almost every box. 

However, it has a horrible chemical-y smell, sort of like plastic? I actually thought it was just from the container and would disappear after drying, but even hours later, I could still smell it on my skin. It's not super strong, but I wear sunscreen on legs, arms and face and reapply frequently, so it's noticeable.

I'll try to use it up because it's so pricey, but definitely will not be repurchasing. Really disappointing because it's wonderful otherwise! Probably good for a beach day, sports, etc. Just not for everyday. * I wanted an everyday spf for my body during the upcoming spring/summer months and I loved the idea of this sunscreen. I especially loved the ingredients and fragrance free aspect. Unfortunately, as other customers reviewed - it does indeed have a scent. I was not too crazy about the scent so I returned it. It's not a fruity or sweet smell, more of a chemical scent which was light but I could smell on my arm especially if my arm was near my face. 
PRO: it does rub in very nicely, no white cast (I'm tanned), not greasy. * Ill preface with this- I am a pale white lady, so I cannot trally speak to if it truly causes a cast. I have not noticed one personally.
I really like how smoothly and quickly this rubs in. And it doesn't smell. Its my daily go to for my body before heading out for the day. The only downfall ive found is that it's pricey. * I am really particular with sunscreen, only using mineral sunscreen. I sort of resigned myself to never finding a mineral one that would be transparent once applied. The nI found this. It's so smooth and leaves zero white residue! * Fine when dry, used at Las Vegas and no sunburns this May. Used again at a waterpark this weekend in June and ended up with sunburns along with the person who helped me finish the bottle so I can go back to my preferred active sunscreen this summer. You could feel the slimy lotion just slipping away as soon as you got into water. And we waited the 15 minutes before we entered the water too. I would never use this around water again and recommend you only use with no water contact intended. We reapplied as recommended so I don't believe this is user error.

Name: sun bum tanning oil spf 15
superscreen rich hydrating cream spf 40 moisturizer
comments:
* I bought this because it had avobenzone but no octocrylene (at the time). Great texture but I reacted badly to something in it. Why ruin a great product everyone loved?? Makes no sense. Ive gone through at least 10 of these moisturizers and now i will no longer purchase. And the new scent is a crime against humanity. * This used to be SOOOO awesome.  Now my face oily by 10 am and feels very irritated.  Also broke me out for the first time in a while.  Had zero issues with the old formula.  I really hope they change it back * What a great and rich sunscreen! The texture of this is super rich and hydrating while feeling so comfortable on my skin. I love that it doesn't leave a white film over my skin, it just soaks right in. Gifted by Supergoop * This was my holy grail of moisturizers with sunscreen for years. Since the formula change, this has given me nothing but problems.

Name: urban environment oil-free sunscreen broad-spectrum spf 42

My foundation will separate within an hour and has a terrible texture. So I only use this product when I'm not wearing make up on its own. I think this would be a great sunscreen for a beach day. * I was so disappointed with the formula and how it leaves a white cast. * Hylauronic acid is supposed to help as an added moisturizer but it ruined this product. At the very least shiseido could bring back the old formula as well? This stuff is hard on skin. Old formula was a dream, so sad it's gone :( * i am a fan of the old formulation, and am disappointed with this "upgrade" by shiseido mainly because unless you continue to reapply throughout the day or finish with powdered makeup it gives a sheen to the skin that becomes shinier over time (and in the humid southeast this is quite an annoyance). this sheen is likely due to the addition of hyaluronic acid and removal of cornstarch from the formulation which means the product grabs onto whatever moisture it can get and no longer has a product to battle excess sebum production. still, it is a good sunscreen and i will use it until it's gone, i just have to reapply or blot my nose at lunch. if you are desparate for a mattifying sunscreen, this is no longer a top choice. also, a lot of consumers really should learn what "oil-free" actually means in makeup land: it does not mean it won't make your skin oily, it means the product is formulated without oil and is usually silicone based (dimethicone, amodimethicone, etc). i think a lot of you would be far more satisfied if you knew what you were talking about and had realistic expectations. * My skin is usually pretty durable when it comes to most products. Except for sunscreen. I have been on the hunt for a good face sunscreen for a long time and I had high hopes when I bought. 

Well I'm currently going through a nightmare allergic reaction that won't go away and I'm on the 5th day after using it only once. Please save your skin and do NOT use this.

comments:
* I am loving COOLA right now. This SPF is perfect for this dreadful Texas humidity and heat. It's very lightweight, non-greasy, and has a pleasant scent. Reapplying is a breeze since the product doesn't build up on the skin or cause a film. It's very breathable and works well with general skin sensitivities. The size is quite large for travel, but still small enough to throw in your beach bag and still have space for other necessities. It has a click-locking spray top so it doesn't accidentally spray in your bag. I will say that if your skin is very dry, you may want to go for a cream SPF because this does not provide much moisture. This is definitely made for hot, sunny summers. I love it and I know for sure I am buying a full-sized bottle to keep on hand.

***This review was collected as part of a promotion.*** * As a professional in the beauty industry, I've learned firsthand the  importance of sun protection, making COOLA's  spray an indispensable asset. In an industry where skincare is very important, COOLA stands out with its dedication to not only protecting against harmful UV rays but also enhancing the overall experience of sun care.

COOLA's sunscreen spray doesn't just shield your skin from UVA and UVB rays; Its broad-spectrum protection ensures comprehensive coverage, safeguarding against both premature aging and potential skin damage. As someone deeply invested in skin health, I love COOLA's commitment to providing a product that protects and cares for my skin.

The scent of Piña Colada fragrance is delicious. Gone are the days of sunscreen smelling like, well, sunscreen. Instead, COOLA's tropical scent transports me to my last vacation. It's a big change from the clinical smell of traditional sunscreens, making the application process a sensory experience.

I did not have any issue in my delicate skin but I always recommend  a patch test.

In my personal opinion, COOLA's in spray isn't just a sun protection product; it's an  evolution of skincare. With its comprehensive protection, anti-aging benefits, and irresistible Piña Colada scent, COOLA has redefined what it means to stay safe in the sun. So, whether I am lounging by the pool or hitting the beach, I make COOLA my go-to companion for summer adventures. And a big pus smells delicious! * The COOLA Piña Colada Classic Body Organic Sunscreen Spray SPF 30 offers a delightful sun protection experience. Its tropical scent evokes visions of sunny beaches and relaxation, enhancing the application process with a touch of indulgence. The organic formula boasts SPF 30, providing reliable protection against both UVA and UVB rays, crucial for preventing sunburn and long-term skin damage. What sets this sunscreen apart is its lightweight texture, which absorbs quickly without leaving a greasy or sticky residue. This feature is particularly appealing for those who dislike the heavy feeling often associated with sunscreen application. The spray mechanism ensures effortless and even coverage, making it convenient for reapplication throughout the day, especially during outdoor activities. Furthermore, the use of organic ingredients adds to its appeal for those who prioritize natural  products. 

 In conclusion, the COOLA Piña Colada Classic Body Organic Sunscreen Spray SPF 30 offers a luxurious and effective sun protection solution for those who appreciate both quality and indulgence in their routine. * As a licensed Esthetician, we our taught early on how important using SPF to protect our skin. My name is Michele and I'm a Beauty Expert in my early 30's with fair combination skin. As the weather gets warmer, I have to make sunscreen a priority in my skincare routine. This is a non-aerosol sunscreen that is so easy to spray onto your skin. It has a lightweight, lighter than air, mist texture that absorbs so quickly into my skin without leaving any greasy residue. I got the chance to try the full size 6 fluid ounce version of this spray sunscreen. This sunscreen is formulated with at least 70% Organic Ingredients. You get broad spectrum SPF 30 UVA and UVB protection. This sunscreen has water resistance that lasts up to 80 minutes so you can enjoy more time in the sun and water without worrying about reapplying every hour. With this amazing sunscreen you not only protect your skin but keep it hydrated too. Plant Protection is formulated with antioxidant rich nutrients which help fight free radicals, hydrates and nourishes your skin barrier too. Safflower Oleosomes is plant derived encapsulation technology that makes this formulation even more effective. Spray this sunscreen on your skin 15 minutes before any sun exposure. Make sure to reapply this sunscreen every 80 minutes. I would recommend this to anyone of any age who loves the sun and wants to have lightweight, long lasting and fast absorbing sun protection that also keeps your skin hydrated too. * Sun care is very important because it can help prevent skin cancer. I can't stress enough how important it is to wear sunscreen everyday. I was looking for a new everyday sunscreen and I think I found it. I prefer spray sunscreen than a cream so this one is perfect. It smells absolutely amazing and I love it! With most sunscreens they can get really heavy and greasy. Another thing I like is the ingredients, because I was having a hard time finding sunscreens that didn't have harsh or harmful ingredients. The Coola brand has organic and vegan ingredients so no worries about having harmful chemicals being absorbed in your body. So far so good and I would repurchase it.

Would buy this again. * I find this sunscreen perfect for sitting under makeup or wearing it alone. * This sunscreen has Butyloctyl Salicylate, a cousin to octisalate, and a chemical UV absorber. That's how they can get a higher SPF with such a low concentration of Zinc or TO. So it isn't purely mineral. I like it and use it, but I wish they wouldn't market it as 100% mineral when it has unregulated chemical UV absorbers in it. * I'm reviewing because I'm shocked to see the negative reviews. I have dry, sensitive, 40s skin with rosacea and occasionally cystic acne only during middle age (yay!). This tinted sunblock is the least *tinted* sunblock I've used. It leaves a very light, shiny, sheer, non-white cast. The shiny component disapeared within a few minutes of application, leaving a very slight glow. It was great for the wrinkles, not for the dark spots. I had to use concealer for any coverage. It's basically inert, but with sun protection. No white cast, no tint, no makeup but apparently good mineral sunblock. But it doesn't cause acne or rosacea for me! I fell asleep on it the first night; sleeping on past sunblocks makes me break out, regardless of the formulation. This one caused zero acne. Zero rosacea. Zero filling in lines; if anything it made my skin look more hydrated and glowing. I'm bummed about the lack of coverage but it's rather exemplary as a sunblock and anti-wrinkle primer. Maybe primer is the best definition. Probably keeping it because it's pretty good and not actively bad.

I find that most mineral sunscreens seem to do really well with a glycerin base moisturizer in my experience, but this one is the best. the only reason i didnt give it 5 stars is because it does go on with a slight white cast at first, but i find that the white cast disappears around 15 or so minutes after application. i'm not sure if i would recommend this sunscreen for darker skinned people because i am very fair skinned and it does initially have a white cast, even on me. besides that, this is the perfect sunscreen for me. I will definitely repurchase!

It would be nice if they created a facial sunscreen that is noncomedogenic. * I used sunscreen everyday. Feels good under makeup! It almost has a matte feeling - sorta like a primer. Name: face lotion spf 50

Because it's such a thin, liquidy formula, a pour component would be much better and less messy because this really is a pain to use. * I do not like the application the pump makes it messy. I wore this primer (under NARS' Light Reflecting Foundation) to a drag show in 80+ degree heat and my makeup didn't budge, even with all the sweat and dancing. I even tried applying foundation to one cheek with primer and one cheek without – the difference in texture was clear. Can't recommend this product enough! * I love applying this daily.  Only wish it came in a larger size so I wouldn't have to run to Ulta so often. * I'm trying to only use mineral sunscreen since I have Melasma after my last pregnancy. It's extremely lightweight vs other heavy and greasy sunscreens. I haven't needed to use my old makeup primers as well, my makeup sits great on top of this.

Name: make it hybrid broad spectrum spf 50
comments:
* *My comment is after having used it for nearly 2 years without skin irritations,  zero burning,  zero breakouts, uncompensated, without biased to any other products, and designated for ALL skin tones. I'm multicultural and have melonated skin.

** The longest memoir version of a review below is what's worked for me, tips, and why I'm using it as a dollar-stretching multi-tasker for all skin. Recommended for all skin tones and ethnicities. It's one of FEW products that offers 50 SPF for both face AND body in a healthy, noncommogenic blend and has stayed reasonably affordable despite competitors. 

The Black Girl Magic Hybrid 50 SPF IS one of the best sunscreens EVER  - yes it does take a learning curve to dispense small amounts of the liquid-consistency lotion because of the packaging but DON'T let that deter you from such a healthy, full-coverage product. Best of both worlds, covering face and body easily and at a dope price, high SPF, and a little goes a loooooong way! Be patient.....

When you first apply this to your skin it should be the LAST step in whatever your personal process might be, depending on if you're toning, serums, and moisturizing you want to give those other steps at least 30 seconds to 1 minute to absorb into your skin. Then apply this SPF last. You will notice a white cast initially, but it has to process - just like all of us. Give it a minute to absorb into your skin and then look in the mirror because you're going to look and feel like a delicious rockstar  : )

I'm usually indoors throughout the workdays. I apply about a dime size on a reusable cloth face pad and gently swipe then dap over face and neck/breast and some of the top shoulder area - this helps me preserve the sunscreen and not overapply it. I know this is redundant but GENTLY apply/swipe/dab, not wiping or pulling the skin or product too aggressively or too quickly. Then use a little larger amount with hands if needing for allover coverage depending on the day/activities/clothing.

Let it absorb and then continue with your day . 

*Don't assume to apply this and then go about your day outside immediately - within 15 mins you should be about ready to go outside with this glow protection-factor - AFTER the white cast absorbs. 

Humbly put your pride and ego to the side when reapplying later in the day because the sunscreen needs to absorb into the skin again and then it becomes invisible.  If you're wanting a purely sheen/invisible look without the zest of glow, go to the bathroom until it absorbs 1st, or just ignore caring that others might notice that you're protecting your skin.. : ) ... and/or try the brand Supergoop Unseen - but downside on that is it's a smaller container, less SPF, more expensive, and a one or the other type of sunscreen whereas *Black Girl Magic Hybrid is quality AND value for both face AND body,  and keeps skin looking and feeling on point,  glowing,  healthy and protected, not clogging or masking feeling. WINNING! 

I suggest using Black Girl Magic Hybrid 50 at home before the day starts and trying the Supergoop Unseen as travel/on the go option for reapplying sunscreen throughout the day.  

Black Girl Magic Hybrid 50 sunscreen is for skin. All skin. Regardless of tone, shade, or hue, this sunscreen is a must have! 

Thanks for reading * The consistency is so loose and liquidy. I hate it! This one also leaves a white cast which to me defeats the purpose of its name. I usually buy the og one, but it was completely sold out. They need to work on the formula of this one. * This is a pretty decent sunscreen! There are plenty of comments about it being runny & leaving a white cast. Please know what youre putting on your face before you do so! Do your research because ALL mineral suncreen is runny & leave a slight white cast. Black girl suncreen is by far the best mineral suncreen I have used. It is not drying and doesnt leave too bad of a white cast. If you know how to work with mineral sunscreen this js perfect for you!! Amazing!!!! They knew exactly what they were doing :) * I usually buy the spf 30, but decided to go for this one as I just saw it had an spf of 50…worst decision I could've made!!! This spf is the worst I think I've ever tried, the consistency is EXTREMELY runny and if you're not careful it will spill/a lot will come out at once. And the smell…THE SMELL!!! Usually I don't mind fragrances at all, but this one is terrible (especially for being "fragrance free"). It also leaves the worst white cast which defeats the whole purpose of the brand! Absolutely would NOT recommend!!! * Black girl sunscreen. Works great  , love it , wouldn't buy any other sunscreen  smell wonderful * This sunscreen was legitimately the first product I have disliked enough to write a review for. Name: vegan collagen every day lotion spf 30
comments:
* I've used this through a couple of bottles. My skin takes time to adjust to products (hence why the couple of bottles). 

I love that it is cruelty free and has vegan collagen. I love that it has SPF 30, a must for me, BUT it smells like sunscreen. It is definitely moisturizing, I don't have an issue with dry skin, BUT it's rather greasy. My daughter has even commented that my face is really greasy when I wear it (not really the vibe I'm going for). The chemicals burn my eyes as the day goes on. If I even wipe my eyes, it takes me minutes to wipe away whatever traces of this moisturizer is around my eyes. If I regularly wore makeup, this would be extra problematic. If you wear contacts, I do not recommend this. Imagine that burning getting caught up under your contacts.

I really, really wanted to love this because I didn't want to go through having my skin adjust to a new product, but I can't justify it based on it being a habit. * As mentioned by others, this would be more accurately described as "SPF 30 sunscreen with collagen." Smells exactly like a normal drugstore sunscreen. It's light and doesn't feel too greasy (but there is still a bit of that feeling). Overall it's ok * Just finished my bottle and ordered another one.  I have sensitive, adult cystic acne, 44 yr old skin that is in the normal to dry stage. This product:
1) has a sunscreen like feel to it when you first apply it, then it fades away
2) has a great glass bottle that you can get ALL of the product out of!
3) Spreads well- at little goes a long way- to much will make it sticky and it won't dry down fast
4) plays well with Good Molecules Hyaluronic acid serum and PUR love your selfie foundation. * I'm getting older, and my skin is changing, and I hate it. My old favorite daily moisturizer/SPF by No. 7 started making me breakout after years of no problems, so I had to search for something new. All the others I tried that claimed to not clog pores also happened to be too drying for my slightly oily but aging but still acne prone and also kinda dehydrated skin (ugh). But the moisture level of this Goldilocks cream is just right. If you have dry or slightly dry skin you will probably like it, if you are 40+ you will probably like it, if you're young and have oily skin you might NOT like it because it is not a light liquid, it's definitely a thick-ish cream. I can tell the fragrance they were trying for was *floral* but it leans more chemical, although it disappears in a minute or two. After application the skin feels moist, but not greasy. Makeup applies perfectly over it with no pilling at all. I somehow manage to not look shiny over the course of the day, which is practically miraculous. It doesn't seem to make me break out, as I've been using it for several weeks with no notable flares. I am relieved to have found my new favorite! * i like how this spf does not leave a white cast like other spfs. Name: fragrance-free mineral body sunscreen lotion spf 50
comments: * This product is horrible if you have any skin tone except fair. Literally so white and even with 5 minutes of rubbing it into your skin, your skin is grey with stripes of whote because it does not absorb. I have medium tan skin and it makes me look ill. Save your money! * Used this on a trip to Hawaii (this is a reef safe sunscreen) - my kids used it when they went snorkeling. It does leave a white cast on skin, but that is to be expected considering the active ingredients and the high SPF. They came back from the snorkeling trip with a nice tan (we have naturally olive skin, so we tan even with sunscreen) and no burns. I use this regularly on my face to boost the SPF from my daytime moisturizer. It does not feel greasy and it doesn't appear shiny at all. There is an almost imperceptible (not visible in photographs) white cast, but I can live with that. I also use it on the backs of my hands and arms to prevent a "car tan" and it has worked well for that so far. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase and I would buy it again. * Do not buy! I'm actually headed to Ulta right now to return this. It'll leave a white cast on any skin tone! And it doesn't blend into the skin no matter how much you rub it in. It's also really dry feeling. Skip this product all together.! * I gave this product one star because it does protect from the sun. But I hated everything else about it. It does not absorb it just sits on top of the skin and it's so white. It's very thick and took a long time to apply. It gets all over everything. Not just your clothes, but anything else you touch or bump into. And it is just as difficult to remove from your skin at the end of the day. I threw this product away after using it a few times. * This is the worst sunscreen I have ever tried. It has a weird, gritty texture and is so hard to rub into the skin. It's also super thick and leaves a very noticable white cast. * A truly reef-safe sunscreen for very, sensitive skin that did not leave a white cast on my dark complexion. It can get white when wet but goes away quickly as you dry. I loved it and it kept my skin soft. * I and my family used this for snorkeling trips that required reef-safe sunscreens. It worked great to protect us from burning. It absorbs better than other mineral sunscreens I have used, but if you use enough to protect you according to the spf rating, you will get a white cast on your skin. I don't think any mineral sunscreen manufacturer should claim that their product is sheer, because to get the spf rating, you will generally have to apply an amount that will show up on your skin. I have sensitive skin and this product did a superb job of providing sun protection as well as a moisture barrier for my skin. I did not get a huge problem with my skin puckering after two hours of swimming in salt water. This product is expensive. I got it on sale. I would never pay full price for this. I suspect it is because of the organic ingredients (not important to me), which probably add nothing to its performance. That plus the "sheer" claim caused me to knock one star off the rating. Nonetheless, it delivers pretty solid performance as an spf 60 sunscreen.

I LOVE this sunscreen it is moisturizing while providing sun protection and a BEATIFUL GLOW. It works well under makeup also. I do recommend applying an actual moisturizer on with it because it works as dew drops. It provides great protection.
I rate it 10/10. * I want to give this 5 star, however when I use it, I find I tend to break out a little. Other than that, I absolutely love it. Gives a beautiful glow and protects really well. This has usually been my go-to for sunscreen when we go to the water park, beach, pool or just days I don't want to wear makeup. I will be looking around for other products to try to avoid getting clogged pores that causes the breakouts but I still love this lotion. * I enjoyed the glow this sunscreen gave me, it went on smoothly, and felt ligtht on my skin. 
It did cause a lot of eye irritation after a few hours of wear, so I dont wear it past my eyes. The product is very watery, and it does spill everytime I apply it. 

I did love this as subscreen for mu arms and neck. * Ok, so when I tried this on my face I got a burning sensation after an hour or so. I initially thought it was something else until I realized it only happened when I used the glow 30. It's weird because I'm not allergic to anything in the ingredients so I'm not sure why I'm sensitive to it. So I almost threw this out, when I decided to try it on my arms and legs so that I wouldn't waste any product and OH. MY. GOD. Literally the best glowy body sunscreen ever. It's not glittery and doesn't look like a spray tan. It just gives the most beautiful natural glow with a touch added coverage. I don't get a reaction to it on my body like I do on my face. Note though that I'm very pale so this might not work on deep skin tones. It's also a very runny product so be careful when opening it and squeezing it out because you actually don't need to really squeeze it, the product will just flow right out. It's kind of annoying but also adds to the benefits of it being good for the body because it means that you need to use less product, so even though it's packaged for the face it provides enough product for the body. Also, I've worn this on my college campus all day and it didn't seem to come off until I took a shower, and it didn't stain or rub off on my clothes! The glow lasted all day without it feeling greasy or leaving any residue on fabrics, so long as I'm careful not to get it on my neckline when I'm applying it. Once it sets on the skin it doesn't budge. I initially bought this from Wegman's on clearance but I'm now buying two more bottles from Ulta for the Summer. * this sunscreen is so amazing for when you want a glowy finish! it wears well under makeup and works wonderfully! * I am in the irritated retinol stage, hoping to be over the hump soon. But in the meantime this has been amazing all my tinted moisturizers or foundation look parch ans dry from the retinol. It look so pretty! * This product is so pretty. I get so many compliments about the glow my skin has and this is my last step before I leave my house. I have told several ladies about this beauty secret.

Name: daily 50 face lotion
comments:
* I don't consider myself to have sensitive skin- acne prone, yes, but not sensitive. I can throw everything but the kitchen sink at my skin when it comes to exfoliating and my skin takes it beautifully. I used this product daily for about a month and started to see some irritation. Thought it was maybe the change in seasons or my other actives. I cut back on those products and the irritation got worse. Started to look like a rash / dermatitis thats caused by heavy moisturizers. Didnt even think thats it was the sunscreen until it was literally the only "new" product on my face. Went back to look at the product more closely. Contains coconut oil, which as an acne prone girly, I know this is very comedogenic / clogs pores / causes dermatitis. Sad because I liked everything else about the product- price, packaging, consistency, absorption, efficacy. Just doesn't work for my skin. 😞 * I started using this sunscreen and I genuinely do like the way it feels on my face and has a pleasent scent! It does protect well considering I was outside for hours and my face did not burned however, if it got into my eyes (just from me rubbing or from sweating) and it would continuously keep burning my eyes. 

I really want to like it however, I may switch back to bare republic mineral sunscreen since I had no issue with that.

Name: healthy renew purified peptides broad spectrum spf 30 day cream

Name: hydrakate illuminating spf 50+ drops

Its a fluid like cream with a slight tint but I wouldn't consider it tinted.  It goes on smoothly, absorbs quickly and doesn't leave any residue.  It made my skin glow, hence the illuminating.  Its perfection with a 50 spf.

It would be great for dry skin girlies. * I think there are better spray sunscreens on the market for a better price. I'm really debating on returning this. Also, the packaging is pretty but it's not practical. I bought this to put in my pool bag and my hiking pack, but it's glass packaging… I get making sustainable packaging but this isn't practical for what I'm using it for. * Maybe I got a bad bottle but the spritzer clogged up to spray a narrow, hard stream. It was bad news when I sprayed it and it hit me in the eye! * I spray this everyday after my normal skin care and makeup routine. It has a light coconut scent that smells wonderful. I had the rash on my face for hours.  I will stick to my regular face sunscreen.  I work out doors and thought this would be better than reapplying my sunscreen (like I have done for yrs). Name: sport face oil-free lotion sunscreen, spf 70+
comments:
* I began using this sunscreen years ago and like others, am not a fan of the new motor oil smell of the current formula.
I continue to use it because, although the smell is terrible, the formula remains effective and keeps me from burning in intense sun and it's modestly priced for an oil free sunscreen that's high in SPF protection. That's what keeps me coming back. 
Keep in mind, this is a sunscreen lotion and not advertised to be a daily moisturizer. I use another SPF product by the same brand for daily use. I only apply this product prior to outdoor activities. * This is my tride and true. It looks fabuslous on its own and underneath makeup. This is it * I hate this sunscreen. I thought it would have a flawless finish like all the korean chemical sunscreens I like. Surprisingly, it doesnt make foundation pill, so that gets a star. I will not repurchase. * I didnt get a sunburn but it is very hard to rub in so you need to apply alot of product. * I used the old version for years and it was nearly perfect; hydrating, easily spread, and non irritating. comments:
* The Coral Reef shade didn't come in my set, Firecracker did. I was looking forward to trying the coral shade the most. Just wish the set was actually the colors advertised! I think the formula is decent, but a little overpriced. * I really like thses.  They smell so good, like mint.
Wish they were available in store. * First off I'd like to say that this is the first time I've tried a tinted SPF lip balm! And I really like what I've tried so far! I've tried these for about 10 days and I really like how they feel on my lips. They are very moisturizing, silk texture and made in such pretty colors! My favorite is the Firecracker color. I like how nicely it glides on and doesn't feel cakey nor weighed down. I love the fact that these has SPF and I don't have to worry when I'm swimming at the pool if I get dried out lips.
