Such high quality products and I'd love to test out other lip balm colors and also try other COOLA products! Perfect for the beach! * First off, I've only been using these for about 5 days and I'm absolutely OBSESSED. I love that it comes in 3 different shades and flavors but mainly the variety!

One of the first things I noticed about the lip sunscreen is how well it works, some products it takes a few days of using it for the effects to really work but this worked immediately, usually my lips crack and dry out depending how long I'm outside but this actually hydrated and protected them from cracking or drying out. One of the other things I loved was the fact you can barely even tell your wearing it! It doesn't feel weird or oily or cakey! And the other thing I loved was the fact it came with 3 different flavors! I highly recommend this product for anyone wanting the perfect go to lip sunscreen!!

This review was collected as part of a promotion. * This lippie trio is a must-have in your vacation bag! To say I'm obsessed is an understatement. I have fair skin and I try to avoid sun exposure as much as possible. (I promise I'm not a vampire.) That being said, I love it when my makeup doubles as my extra sun protection! I was so excited to try these tinted lip balms out, and I am so glad I did! The color payoff for these lip balms is pretty amazing. You can build up the coverage or sheer them out. They all have a different scent to each color, and each one smells great. I did also experiment with using the lip balms as a blush and I was extremely pleased with the results. My favorite shade out of the pack has to be 'Summer Crush' due to its vibrant color. If you're a lip balm girlie, you are going to need these if you are out in the sun. This review was collected as part of a promotion * The coolas travel mineral lip trio was just perfection! Every color was beautiful and the packaging was spot on! These lippies provide spf 30, is definitely 40 mins water resistant and glides on like a charm! I went away for the weekend and the hotel I was staying at had a pool where I decided to put them through the  water resistant test. Let me tell you it did not rub off at all! Every lippie has a different name and beautiful crafted smell that definitely goes with the name. The packaging said to apply 15 mins before sun exposure which I did and It held through the whole day with a second reapplication because the sun was really harsh that day. I also forgot to bring blush and I used the firecrackers lippie on my cheeks and it gave me a natural beachy cheeky glow. Blended in my cheeks so seemingly. I love what the brands stands for and how the ingredients are great! * COOLA's Organic Lip Sunscreen with a 30 SPF comes in 3 different shade and flavors. These are organic and vegan. I like that It shields my lips from both UVA and UVB rays, preventing sunburn. I spend most of my free time gardening and these have been a life saver for my lips. I love how compact the tube is which makes it easier to carry around in my small crossbody bag. These glide easily and not chalky at all compared to other products I've used. I really like that these provide a subtle amount of tint, it's more of a natural tint. These are perfect for when you want to add a subtle amount of color without having to go all out. Each color is different and perfect for when I want to change it up. I was surprised with the scent and flavor, it's not overpowering. Firecracker is actually my go to right now. My one complaint is that I wished these were more moisturizing. These are perfect for summer! I can't wait to take these to the beach with me. I recommend 100%

Name: hello sunshine spf 50 pa ++++
comments: * I have very dry, acne prone, sensitive skin. I've been on the hunt for a sunscreen that doesn't exacerbate any one of these issues. I don't use mineral sunscreens because they don't agree with my dry skin. This sunscreen is almost perfect. It doesn't burn my skin, it doesn't cause any skin flushing, it's hydrating, it doesn't pill, it doesn't break me out. Unfortunately it caused my eyes to sting horribly throughout the day. I really loved this sunscreen at first, and I was so disappointed. I'll continue to use it as a body sunscreen though.

Name: self reflect sport sunscreen spf 60
comments:
* I do not know what magic they put in this, but they cracked the code. I am a medium skinned black woman and there is no white caste, even after working out for an hour! Also, it is so comfortable, it does not feel like you are wearing anything AND it is very moisturizing.  I could not stop touching my face. 
This version is better than the non sweatproof version and the best mineral sunscreen I have ever tried, and I have tried a lot. * This is perfect for your outdoor activities--high SPF , water/sweat resistant with very minimal white cast for a zinc-only sunscreen at that high SPF (give it a little time for the slight white to dissipate-note however that i am fairly pale). I also use this on my neck and chest for everyday wear because it doesnt get "orange" tint on my collars and 
clothing like my everyday tinted spf does. It feels moisturizing in the skin. It is very different from kinships spf 30 product although I Highly recommend you try both!! * first one suits my sensitive skin, no more irritation and watery eyes due to sunscreen * I love the other Kinship SPF so I thought I'd give this one a try since it's "water resistant" and SPF60. I don't see HOW this is water resistant because it never sets and its continuously greasy, on top of that my skin STILL managed to dry out two hours after I've applied it. It rubs off into everything and if you touch your face at any point in the day (I've worn it for 6+ hours) it moves and gets into everything. I've almost finished the whole tube thinking maybe it's user error... it could still possibly be the case. I'm 30 with rosacea, combination dry skin with hormonal breaks out and a thyroid condition that tends to dry my skin and hair out.. I wanted to like this sunscreen but it's a big no. I can't make it work, I've tried it alone, with moisturizer, under makeup, with serum only. I don't feel protected when I wear this sunscreen. It's also got this iridescence to it that at first I thought I would like but it just makes you look like *shiny* vampire. * After using the kinship self reflect spf 30 for several months, this sunscreen is definately my preference over the self reflect. It takes about 5 minute after application for it to absorb and the cast to disappear. The long term benefits for my very sensitive combo skin have been amazing. The keratosis bumps on my cheeks have completely disappeared and this is the only product I have change in my routine. It has a very subtle vanilla scent that disapears shortly after application. Name: sheer tint sun serum

I never had any skin issues before using this and after over a year of monthly dermatologist visits my skin is still not fully recovered. * Mad Hippie advertises that their sunscreen is Reef Safe but it contains butyloctyl salicylate which is NOT a reef safe ingredient. Name: clear skin oil-free moisturizer zinc oxide sunscreen spf 30
comments: * Love how matte my skin looks. It hasn't made me break out unlike other sunscreens. * Very disappointing for a claim won't cause breakouts. Immediately caused breakouts and congestion. Also very drying cracking skin around nose. I have combo skin

Name: advanced retinol daily repair moisturizer broad spectrum spf 30
max clear invisible priming sunscreen broad spectrum spf 45
comments:
* I've tried many primers with SPF, and this is my favorite as it actually blurs pores the most and has the highest SPF. It's my daily primer. * I liked this spf until it reached the end. The bottle was very hard to swueeze. I was about to throw it out and decided to cut the package. There was still anton of product left! * It works very well under my makeup and makes my skin look younger. I will definitely buy this product again. * Really nice ,smooth sunscreen. Blends well with my skin with no white cast. * I really like this. It helps my make up go on easier. * I like that the finish blurs the skin & that it's SPF 45. It doesn't leave a white cast on me it's free of oxybenzone & octinoxate which can be harmful to sea life so I suppose you can wear it to swim/dive, if you're into that.

Personally I'm not a fan of the texture. It's soft and satiny which I find makes it hard to spread, so I deducted a star. It's not as "wet" as the Supergoop Unseen Sunscreen- it's more like an ointment

Can't comment on pilling as I always do a pre-check with whatever I'm wearing under my sunscreen to make sure they'll play nice together. 

Also haven't worn it under makeup yet but it my skin looks similar to when I wear my smashboxx blurring primer so my guess it'll be good as a Primer too * It goes on clear so no white cast which is nice. But it is kind of thick and heavy. It takes a little while to actually settle on the skin. I would probably switch back to the super goop unseen instead.

Name: bright reveal broad spectrum spf 50 daily uv
comments: * I decided to buy this sunscreen after reading the reviews and decided to give it a try. But I have nothing else to say except bad things about it. I have normal to dry skin, so I thought this would be a good fit for me since it's hydrating. However, it peels off instantly and don't even think to wear it under makeup. Plus, it leaves a white cast every time I apply it. I'm pale white. This is a big regret for me. * If you have olive undertones or tan skin in general this is not for you. The white cast is horrible and this sunscreen does not blend well at all. Made me extremely greasy and peely.

Name: hyperpigmentation essentials glow up set
comments: * The tinted sunscreen does leave a slight cast, the color stick is perfect, and the hyperpigmentation serum needs better packaging because you have to dig out the product at end. Overall good value, but wont be purchasing full size items.

Name: hydrating facial spf 25+
comments:
* This moisturizer is incredible.  I have been using for over a year now and it is the only moisturizer that can keep my skin hydrated in the winter (and I tried many products!) Nongreasy, clean ingredients too. Safe to use while pregnant, and smells great. My go to moisturizer.  I even use it during the day in the winter under my makeup. Don't need it during the summer during the day, but still use nightly! * I wanted to like this since I love their Vitamin C serum. My skin is kinda dry and has some imperfections that the additional Vitamin C would have helped. But, my husband can't tolerate the smell. The smell is bearable to me, but he stays away till the smell fades. After using it every night for about 2 weeks, my skin feels like it's lacking moisture. That's the only thing in my regular routine that I changed. I may try adding a face oil and try and finish using it to see if it smooths out my imperfections and report back. * If you have oily skin, this probably won't work well for you, but it has done wonders for my dry skin. Absorbs pretty quickly and is not heavy on the skin. * I use this every night after I wash my face. It's hydrating and smells great * I like the Mad Hippie skincare line, rates very high on Yuka because it's all natural ingredients. However, there is a strong smell to it… not sure if its the vitamin C smell or if it's something else in there… to me it smells metallic and it takes me out. I really think a little goes a long way for this product. I did not know it clogs pores, I did not have that issue so far and I have lots of blackheads. Maybe I haven't used it enough. It is also very pricy… I think I'm going to use the regular face cream from now on since it smells nicer and absorbs better. If you want to have the vitamin C factor, I recommend the vitamin C toning mist and the vitamin C serum. They smell amazing and work great. I think I'll be returning this one. * I used to love this night cream! Mad Hippie is my go to brand for everything! It has cleans ingredients and will not make me break out! 
But they changed everything, the new versions/recipe of this cream stinks so bad i couldnt even put it on my face and almost threw up. It makes me sad because now i have to find another night cream. 

The older version was amazing! Absorbed perfectly and hydrated my face within minutes.

I wish they wouldn't of changed it * I have been using this for quite a while and I loved the way it smells and feels until they changed the formula. It is thicker and has an odd smell, I like fragrance and I understand some people are sensitive but they should offer two options then. It smells odd and whatever is in it is now very noticeable in the smell with the pleasant smell it had before.

Name: megashade breakout-proof spf 50 serum
comments: * Ive tried to order this new updated pump packaging twice now from Ulta and have received the dropper bottle. * Oily, acne prone skin and wow! It leaves my skin stunning and no breakouts. Just dont get it in your eyes because that stings. * The ingredients listed on the ulta site/app are VERY incorrect. I have a skin allergy and was pretty disappointed when this arrived and the box listed 4x as many ingredients as the website. * I have dry skin & I initially enjoyed this sunscreen. At first it was hydrating without excess oils & silicones but hours later my skin would feel dry again, maybe due to the Hyaluronic Acid in this. The twist bottle also opens on its own and spilled all over my drawer. * I have stuffled looking for an amazing sunscreen that goes well with extremely sensitive skin and dry skin and is SPF50. I experience no stinging, tingly, burning, or redness on my face. The price is definitely worth purchasing and rebuying. Happy to say I have found my go to product. * Why aren't more people talking about this sunscreen? It is amazing. Very light sunscreen scent dissipates quickly. It leaves my skin lightly hydrated, glowy and I use it all over. I am in my third bottle. I am VERY picky about sun protection and this is phenomenal. * This product claims to be a multitasker but it didn't sit well under my makeup and burned my eyes when I perspired. For the price point I expected more. With what's available now leaving no whitecast isn't as valuable as it used to be. Check out anthelios if you don't have $40 to spend on mid products.

Name: liftactiv peptide-c face sunscreen spf 30
comments:
* My skin is somewhat sensitive. Not many products, including sunscreen, break me out, but the ones that do, REALLY mess me up. This sunscreen broke me out terribly. Not all over the face, but a few cystic blemishes, including one of my nose. I'm still dealing with the scarring from that :( The scent on this is VERY strong. I am not sensitive to scents at all. I don't care when products are scented, but there is no need for it be this strongly scented. What were they thinking? 

I bought this during the beauty days sale so I will keep it and use it on my neck and chest for the anti-aging benefits, but if you are breakout prone from sunscreens, be very careful with this one. * My first time trying out this face sunscreen and it feels nothing like all the others I've tried and used under makeup! This is veil like, smooth application…. BUT!!! The scent! The scent is STRONG and it does not go away even after you applying foundation or bb cream… I really wanted to love this product because of the peptides but im disappointed I will not be using it as I wanted due to the smell. Side note the description does indicate there is a floral scent to it (i missed reading that part) I agree it is a floral scent except it is strong! * I like how this goes on and the potential benefits, however, it irritates my rosacea and makes me redder. * When I first used it, I loved the cosmetic elegance and how it feels on my skin. Yes, like what everyone was saying, the fragrance is so strong. I typically do not have any reaction to any active ingredients. I use VC, VA, anything with no problem. I had my first allergic reaction three weeks ago. I was red, a bit swollen, very itchy from face to neck. I thought other new products I just opened and used caused it, and at that time i was using other sunscreen for sensitive skin. Two weeks ago I started using this again on a day I ate a lot of seafood, so I thought it was the seafood gave me the same reaction. Now I was totally healed and used this sunscreen for the third times, and again my entire face look like monster. I wonder what exact ingredient gave me allergy. * Would have been okay, the scent is strong, but this stung my eyes after about an hour. * This is a great product, but they kind of ruined it with a SUPER strong fragrance. I don't dislike the fragrance itself, it actually smells okay (to me it smells like those scentsicles you put in your artificial  christmas tree to make it smell real), but it is SO super strong, it's all I can smell all day. Like, even over the actual perfume I put on, this smells stronger. So I'm docking a star for that. Otherwise, it is matte, non-greasy (and I have extremely oily skin), doesn't make me get super greasy over the course of the day, and moisturizes well enough that I don't need a separate moisturizer or even eye cream underneath. I haven't noticed any anti-aging effects yet but I've only been using it for a few weeks. It's kind of expensive, but not outrageously so. I like the formula so I'm going to use up the tube, but because of the fragrance I probably won't repurchase unless I get used to it enough that it stops bothering me. * I've been in the beauty industry for over 12 years so tried A LOT of products including sunscreen. This one from Vichy was really at the top. 

I live in Texas and try to use sunscreen everyday. The product is non-sticky, absorbs quickly with no white film. It also has a very appealing, skincare smell. My makeup went over the sunscreen very easily.  

While the number one reason I use sunscreen is for the SPF protection all the extra goodies, like Vitamin C, really made me feel good about using it on my skin

The packaging is really sleek but more importantly the dispenser is great. Nice amount and very smooth. Sunscreen tubes can get really messy, and this one does not. 

This one is a keeper! Full disclosure I got this product through Stellar Product Testing Panel but fully stand by my review.

Name: antioxidant face shield mineral spf 30
comments: * It does produce a glow but needs higher SPF especially during peak Florida summer * I usually don't leave reviews. But this smell is terrible...it literally smells like trash * This product has such great reviews and I had high hopes as a mineral sunscreen superuser. But it didnt live up to the hype- the smell is gross as other people mentioned and it left my skin greasy. Minimal white cast at least but still not my fave. * I personally am not a fan of how this product looks on my skin and how it feels. I've been using it daily for the past month or so since I got it to really give this product a shot but it's not it. I dont understand the "glow" everyone else is talking about but on my skin freshly after washing and everything it is extremely greasy and stays like that all day. I will give it credit for not leaving much of a white cast, easily blending into the skin, and looking nice under makeup but the thick greasy feeling I can't get over. My skin is on the dryer side if that means anything to anyone. Also if I go out on a really nice sunny day right after applying my face still burns!?!?!?! so not very sheilding. For me it is not worth the money or time. * I am on probably my fourth or fifth bottle of this. I have very dry skin so some might find it a little too dewy looking but I love it. No white cast. Looks great under makeup. And I've never gotten sunburned. I can't imagine wanting to try anything else. * This was recommended to me by of the Utla Associates and she said, once I started using it I wouldn't go back to the one I was originally looking for and she was right. * Light weight,  dries smooth and no white finish on skin.

Name: capital soleil tinted face mineral sunscreen spf 60
comments:
* It balls up, pills and comes off EVERY SINGLE TIME.
I shake it until the cows come home
I use just ONE moisturizer underneath it
I put it on NAKED skin

It PILLS, without fail * this is my new foundation. 2 in 1 for sure. I am going for a second bottle. * I've used heavy full coverage foundations for almost 20 years. I wanted to add sunscreen and skincare to my makeup. tried several tinted serums, sunscreens, moisturizers, but this one actually has some coverage and gives you a glow. I stopped wearing foundation completely now. this is my daily go to. if I need extra coverage I use a little concealer. I still do my smoky eye and it looks great * Product is definitely oily and even after shaking VERY well, it was still separating and had almost sandlike grains in it. Additionally it was not blendable at all and made my lightly tanned skin look ghostly. Am returning asap. * Love this product!  Fantastic protection and a light moisturizing coverage.  This product does it all. * I am a repeat buyer! I am fair complected and the tint really works for my skin tone. That said, it's not the best ever and ever. I do feel that it doesn't fully dry down and I wish it had more filters than just titanium dioxide. I keep using it! But am forever on the hunt for a different one as well * I have tried soooo many mineral sunscreens, and they have all been disappointments in one or more ways: thick as glue, wierd unpleasant smell, settles into expression lines and wrinkles, globs onto fine facial hair or hairline, balls up when applied over other products, tinted products too dark and orangey tan… BUT this one is absolutely perfect, a joy to use as it has none of those drawbacks, none!  The weight and consistency is very light, like applying a serum; yet it offers enough coverage to even out tone.  I only have to apply a tiny bit of concealer here and there, to feel polished and glowy. I never spend prolonged time out in direct sun without a big hat, but the Spf seems to be really good (I use 8 drops to cover my face). I had a problem with the nozzle and cap getting messy with oozing overflowing sunscreen everytime I shook the bottle, but taking off the cap and firmly covering the nozzle tip with my finger while shaking solves that issue.

Name: mineral sunscreen zinc oxide broad spectrum spf 30
comments:
* I just jeep coming back too it. I have combo sensative acne prone skin and its just unbeatable! * doesnt leave a white cast, didnt break me out, protexts my skin from the sun, sits well under makeup, feels like a moisturizer, dosesnt pill. this is the beat spf ive ever used and ive been looking for one for so long * This is very difficult to absorb onto skin, it is thick, sticky, and when it transfers into your eyes it is the worst burning and irriating feeling ever and needs to be washed off immediately. I love FAB products but this is NOT it. * Very heavy sunscreen. Does not blend well and leaves white cast. Will not be purchasing again. * At this price point I expected better. It's very hard to find a sunscreen without niacinamide and butyloctyl salicylate and I am so glad I found one! * Had worse, but offers a bit of a white cast and like others have said is a bit streaky and drying

There are better, much cheaper sunscreens out there

Name: super fluid daily uv defense spf 50+
comments:
* I have greasy, combo, acne prone, olive toned skin and now use this every day. It feels really great on the skin and does not clog my pores. * It is second time to me to use it because I love it and it's perfect on my skin!! * when it comes to sunblock I want to cringe at the price but it works SO WELL and my skin doesn't break out AT ALL when using this.
I know I'll be rebuying it once I run out. * Again - poorly packaged; leaked all over the very small bottle.  Over priced for the amount. * Don't like this product. If u sweat it will burn and irritate your eyes. * I have several Kiehl's products, I am in love with this brand and have the best skin I've had in a long time. Some things I deal w/ are being acne-prone, oily, rosacea and very sensitive. I've been doing some research on rosacea and have read that wearing a daily SPF can help with redness (among many other benefits, of course). I wanted to make sure I was getting a product from a brand I believe in because face sunscreen has been tricky for me. It's usually greasy and breaks me out significantly. I spent the extra money for this product and am unfortunately not very pleased. Like other comments, this product does ball up on the face. I find that I have to let my daily moisturizer sink in for AT LEAST 10 minutes before I can put on my sunscreen. And the more you try to massage it into the face, the more it will ball up. Other than that, my MAJOR complaint about this product is that after applying and about an hour after it's on my face, my skin starts to burn. It feels as though I have a mild sunburn across my entire face where you can feel the discomfort and burn. Again, I have sensitive skin and apparently it's just not reacting well with me. I've gone a few days without it and then tried it again and it is 100% this sunscreen. I'm out side of my return time so I'm stuck with it and really disappointed. I hate having to purchase products to figure out what works for my skin. Just writing this in-depth review for those of you with the same kind of skin as me...just to think twice. I will say, it does eventually sink into my skin and does not leave it greasy so that's a positive. * Since it is new to me, I am still trying to learn the right amount to apply. Too much (first try) and I had to blot it to make it just right. Second day, it was fine. It does not leave a white cast, definitely a pro. For its high quality, the price is reasonable!

Name: broad spectrum spf 50 sunscreen body cream
comments: * I have gone on outdoors and swimming. It never disappoints when it's body protection. Against let's say, Neutrogena spray-on SPF, I got sunburned on the areas where I used the latter one, and the Clinique SPF protected areas remained unharmed.

Name: botanical tinted face sunscreen spf 50
comments:
* Im a chemical sunscreen girl, but I kept seeing this sunscreen on social media so I decided go give it a try. 

PROS: 
- whipped texture 
- neutral tones 
- matte finish 
- absorbs oil
- good around the eye area 
- great for oily skin and/or summer
- 50+ SPF
- great for an active lifestyle

CONS: 
- feels a little heavy until it sets 

I do two layers of sunscreen: first a chemical sunscreen and then a mineral sunscreen. This is the best mineral sunscreen I've tried (Neutrogena, Cerave, MDSolarSciences, DMTLGY). * It's REALLY good, just not for someone with dry skin. I do like the texture, coverage, natural looking color, and the overall matte apperance but after 30 minutes it dries me out so bad. It would be good for humid days/someone with "normal" skin. * Over all good but very prone to rub off on clothing. Can't use near v neck and don't pull a top over your head. * The title says it all.  I purchased this, very excited to have found a sunscreen that is spf 50 and tinted AND acne safe.  Read some reviews saying it was not good at all, etc, great for oily skin.  This is why I was happily surpised that on my fair, dry skin it felt and looked great.  It was a little bit dark for my skin but it just made me look bronzed there wasn't any harshness or orange.  And it felt good on my skin under makeup (concealer and powder) all day.  Very suprised it also did not transfer.  Overall great product but I am suspicious of how it is spf 50 when the active ingredients do not indicate this at all. * Favorite daily sunscreen! It's been so hard for me to find one that doesn't irritate my skin! Plus, it's cruelty free, and reef friendly while not being too expensive for the large amount in one tube. It's an amazing product! * This is literally impossible to wash off! In the shower I washed my face FIVE times and I'm still seeing remnants of orange looking clay-like product on my face. I wouldnt reccomend to anyone unless you're into permanent makeup that dries orange and cakey. * This product is only 4% zinc oxide! There is NO WAY this can offer any protection. I thought it looked nice on my face and recommended it to a friend, then we both burned the first day the sun came out. Should have looked at the actual percentage of the active ingredients; the FDA recommends 10%- 20% zinc oxide in sunscreen. This won't protect you!

Name: wonderscreen broad spectrum spf 30
comments: * Does what is supposed to, but the white cast is insane! Feels super heavy and oily on my dry skin and it peels when appliyng makeup. * It is now 2024 and we still have physical sunscreens that give darker skin women a white cast. The 12 dollar Neutrogena sunscreen will give you the same results. Save your money. * Another physical sunscreen that pictures black women but then isn't inclusive. It still gives whitecast on brown skin. Disappointed. * For me personally I found it to be watery and made my face look pasty white. Just like the kind you would get from normal skinscreen. Granted it does smell good and does the job of protecting my skin. * This spf is so lightweight and easy to wear under makeup. I have very oily skin and for a change a spf lotion didn't make it worse. I can't recommend this enough * The actual sunscreen is great but unusable because of the pump. Have to take off lid and try to fish out little globs of it to actually use. Too bad. How could their quality dept approve this packaging?! * I really like the product itself. Unfortunately it's a little too thick for the pump to dispense it. I have to take the lid off and use the pump stick to swipe it on my hands. Also, ran out after just a couple of weeks of use. Perhaps I got a bottle that had been returned and the previous person used a lot of the product?

Name: kids spray & play spf 50 sunscreen
comments: * I wanted to love this more. When I sprayed it on my face, the product seeped into my eyes and burned the rest of the night. If I spray it on my hands and apply it that way, I love how it sits on my skin. Nice glow but heavy fragrance.

Name: mineral sunscreen broad spectrum spf 50 face and body lotion
comments: * Think this is a great sunscreen. Doesn't leave a white layer on your skin. Rubs in easy while protecting your skin. * I'm very disappointed, this is definitely Not Avene. The smell is ghastly and the texture is very dense much more the original Avene . * Smells awful but wears nicely with no white cast on fairer skin, however for deeper skin it would likely be unsuitable. You get a great amount for the price compared to equivalents from Supergoop, LRP, RoC, and others. * I can't believe this is an Avène product.  All their products are usually light, fresh, airy, & pleasant.  THIS ONE SMELLS TERRIBLE.  I CAN't stand it.  Smells old, musty, almost stale like & chemically.  Runny consistency.  I'm so DISAPPOINTED. I looked up reviews and I see I'm not the only one. (Thought maybe I got a bad bottle). Not sure what happened with this one. * Unlike most mineral sunscreens, this doesn't leave a white cast and isn't drying. However, it's pretty greasy even for my dry skin. I have to powder it down. * I got this because the picture looked somewhat clear and sounded safe for skin. This is terrible. Its thick white and leaves a nasty white coating on skin and smells/feels terrible. Its waxy and horrible. * I got this sunscreen in a gift with purchase and tried it immediately. I was excited because usually (unfortunately) many chemical sunscreens break me out and this didnt have anything but zinc oxide. It was a little heavy and took a little longer to blend out than others ive used but after blending it was definitely a dewy sunscreen. It wore well under my minimal makeup but was a little more dewy than i usually like.

Name: block star sheer liquid daily sunscreen spf 50
comments:
* This is one of my favorite sunscreens, I'm very fair and the white cast really evens out my skin, it looks like I am wearing a tinted moisturizer. If you're super pale and in the market for a tinted moisturizer or sunscreen, I cannot recommend this enough! * I'm actually a fan of other Bliss products, but I have never experienced a whiter cast from sunscreen in my life. I could tell it would have one as it came out of the bottle, but wanted to trust the "sheer" claims. Will be returning. * I really like the light weight feel of this sunscreen, espeically for a mineral one. Although I find it pills under makeup and can cling to dry spots. So best for a no makeup day. * Iv tried a lot of sunscreens and I mean alot . Every single sunscreen I have used breaks me out even mineral ones. This sunscreen is by far the best one iv ever used its just amazing . * This sunscreen is so good. I've tried so many sunscreens and this one has everything I want. It actually absorbs, no white cast, it doesn't get into my eyes, and it's recyclable. * I need to stick to mineral sunscreens for my skin, so it's been hard for me to find one that leaves a minimal white cast, has high SPF, and is water-resistant. I just finished my first bottle of this, and so far I think it's one of the better ones I've tried! It doesn't irritate my skin, blends impressively for SPF 50, and doesn't feel heavy at all.

I have tan skin, so I usually wear a BB cream over this to cancel out the slight white cast this leaves. Note that it's a high SPF, untinted *mineral* sunscteen, so I cannot expect it to be fully clear. 

The one downside is that this seems to turn white in areas that get wet or have a lot of friction, such as under the bridge of your glasses. It can be rubbed back in very easily, but that's something to note. * I love the other bliss sunscreen but I wanted to try this one since it's SPF 50. This sunscreen left the worst white cast on my skin no matter how long I rubbed it in.

Name: luminizing facial spf 29
comments:
* eceived this product for free it was a gifted from MadHippie. It was a nice sunscreen! I wore it at the beach and it lasted a while and I did not get burnt. I would recommend this product it was very nice. 
Complimentary from madhippie * Pros
1) no white cast
2) does not melt into eyes like Neutrogena sunscreen and cause eye pain/tears
Cons
1) product separates. It's like ketchup where sometimes just the liquid comes out of the tube. There is no indication on the tube that the product must be shaken, so I assume that this is just poor formulation. 
2) sunscreen remains sticky to touch, even after an hour (ambient temp was 75degr, humidity was 40%, so it's not because of the weather!)
3) the sunscreen rubs off and leaves white marks on my black athletic shorts, even after an hour

For this low amount of SPF at this price point, I expect a better product. I have not tried to apply makeup over this product, but I don't even want to try based on how this sunscreen performs on a bare face. 
Thankfully, I received this product as a gift. * I have never tried anything from Mad Hippie but I was so excited to try this beautiful product.  I try to protect my skin at all cost because it's very important to me so I always apply sunscreen on face . I headed out on a hike and six miles in, it started melting and oozing into my eyes.  There was nothing I could do at that point. Worst sunscreen ever. Buy Goop Unseen Sunscreen. * Best SPF ever. I love the glowy finish and it even works under my makeup. * I tried this in store while shopping and immediately fell in love, I've been using it for 2 weeks now. The glow that it gives my skin is beautiful, it also does not leave a white cast nor feels like a traditional SPF. I even tried it under makeup and it made everything look dewier and smoother. I highly recommend!

Name: mineral lotion spf 30
comments:
* I love Sun Bum products and really wanted to love this. I was looking for a high SPF mineral formula without too much of a white cast. This was OK on first application - a little thick though so you need to work it in; then as you reapply, it turns into glue. Takes a lot to get it off of your body in the shower. However, no sunburns with multiple applications. No skin irritation. * It's not terrible, but I do not like it remotely, HALF as much as I like the Ulta brand one. I'm new to mineral sunscreens and I bought 2 from Sun Bum and 1 from Ulta. Both of the Sun Bum mineral sunscreens (SPF 30 and 50) are chunky and ridiculously harder to spread on the body. I felt like I was spreading toothpaste, or bondo on my legs and arms. I couldn't imagine trying to put it on my face. The Ulta brand is a sheer delight to put on in comparison. I felt like I COULDN'T rub it in and get past the white cast, and I am so pale I could blend in with a cloud. After seeing how hard it was on my legs (30SPF) and arms (50SPF), I didn't DARE use it on my face and I used the Ulta instead. 50SPF was the intended sunscreen for the face, but that wasn't happening with how delicate my face is from acne right now. Yeesh. I'll use the Sun Bums, and my husband will, but I definitely wouldn't repurchase it. Makes me reconsider the entire line from this brand after both tubes were so much chunkier in consistency and THICCER than your girls thighs versus Ulta's. * This is thick upon applying it, but after about 10 minutes it settles. I love this for my sensitive, allergy-prone skin. It is also chemical free which is great for sensitive skin! My favorite part is the no white cast. I don't know how they managed to do it without tinting it, but this is POC friendly. Also doesn't pill like most physical sunscreens do. * I purchased to use as a moisturizer sunscreen per recommendation of store associate to protect hyperpigmentation. This product is very thick and sticky. It burns my skin also. Not a good purchase. * I used the spf 50 version of this formula, but sadly it was too heavy for me and caused breakouts. This formula seems much lighter, the white cast is not bad, and the feel is good! Still a bit on the heavier side of sunscreens for me, which is why this is going to be my go-to winter sunscreen. I won't bother to look for another, this one does it the best! * A little background on my skin: I'm a redhead and have very fair/ pale skin (alabaster foundation) which is moderately sensitive and burns easily (and won't ever tan, it just peels and burns again). This sunscreen uses fragrance, but doesn't irritate my skin. It feels lightweight and not greasy. The formula is thin enough to easily apply and rub in quickly (much better than the Cotz mineral sunscreen for face and body, non tinted). It smells like coconut, which I love, and doesn't leave a cast or sticky grease layer on my skin.
If you have a deeper complexion than me and are concerned about a cast, I couldn't say for sure but I think this stuff is worth a try since it's so thin and rubs in so well. If you have very sensitive skin, just tread carefully as the scent is very strong. Definitely worth a try, but keep the receipt just in case it doesn't work for you. Hope this helps! * The only downside is that this uses fragrance. Thankfully, my skin isn't extremely sensitive so this is okay for me, but if you have very sensitive skin or are allergic to coconut I would tread carefully if you try this. If you don't have sensitive skin, it smells so nice and absorbs quickly without leaving a cast. However, I have very pale skin (I usually use Alabaster foundation with cool undertone) and don't know if this will leave a cast if you have a deeper complexion. It's thin enough that it's probably worth a try though, since you can rub it in so well. Hope this is helpful!

Name: mineral sun stick spf 45
comments: * Very frustrated that Cotz advertises itself as healthy and ecoconcious when non of its products are. This Product received a poor raring on Yuka App. Product contains many harmful ingredients including dimethicone  which harms the environment and ends up in the blood of fish, birds and mammals building up in the environment without ever breaking down. Cotz advertising is an example of brand green washing at its finest. * This is good for touch ups when you're on the go. Despite being a stick format, it has a mousse like texture. I like that it can fit in a pocketbook (the cylinder shape makes it awkward for a pants pocket). This does feel heavy on my skin (normal/balanced type) and has a sticky/tacky feel after application. This also left a whitecast on my skin (Fitzpatrick type 2, fair Asian Skin, wear clinque foundation in shade bone; I swiped at least 4x per section of my face to have adequatecl coverage). The finish is definitely on the shiny side, especially for me. My preference is for matte or skinlike finish, so this was too shiny for me, but someone who likes a glowy finish may like this. I would recommend this for someone with fair skin on the dry side (or balanced/normal in a dry climate) and doesn't mind a shinier/"glowy" finish.

Name: mineral sunscreen lotion spf 50
comments:
* I use this daily on my face, neck, chest, and hands, alone or as a primer. I do rub it in well and have learned to avoid my eyelids, but around my eyes is fine. If you have oily skin, this one may not stay put. I have combination skin, fair and pink and prone to sunburn. It is one of the only mineral sunscreens that I will put on my face because I'm prone to breakouts. It's this or Cotz. Since Cotz is a tiny tube for the money, I got this to travel with and not need a separate body sunscreen. I've never gone back!

On your body, be sure to rub it in well. If you don't, it will transfer to your clothes. * It leaves a horrible white cast, and melts off when I sweat. It's really thick, and no matter how little I use, or how much I blend, I can't make it work. * It leaves a horrible white cast, and melts off when I sweat. It's really thick, and no matter how little I use, or how much I blend, I can't make it work. * I've been using this daily for about 2 weeks and love it.  I don't have any issues with a white cast so I'm not sure if other reviewers who have are using it correctly. I have dark olive skin and it looks fine on me. Just rub it in good.  It doesn't get greasy at all. I'm very pleased and will buy again. * Number 1, you need to use 1/4 tsp on your face and neck to get the spf protection on the label, for any brand. But the awful white cast just made me use less. Using the proper amount would make me look like a ghost. In fact, it actually did in a group photo a friend posted. When I saw it I was like OH NO. And I even had foundation over it. Also nice that you can't even read the new packaging. I'll use this up on my feet or arms I guess. * The scent is super strong and leaves a white cast. * It does NOT smell like sunscreen and it protects so well. Takes a little bit to rub in but very happy

Name: hydrance+ moisturizing sunscreen lotion spf 30
comments: * Oil-free but feels slimy and has a weird smell.  I have combo skin so it feels really greasy.  Glad I got it on sale and won't repurchase. * Might work on super dry skin, but not for my normal (sometimes normal/oily combo) skin.   Makeup is sliding off after 30 minutes.  Glad I purchased while on sale because not worth the full price.  Will keep to use on hands and neck since it does not smell and still need sunscreen protection. * I live by Avene products and wanted to love this so badly. The skincare in it makes my skin so glowy and hydrating and I love how dewy my skin looks when wearing. It wears well under make up, but you do have to rub it in well to prevent the white cast and so that the product absorbs in fully. It does feel a little bit sticky and a little heavy, but I don't necessarily mind that. Overall it feels more like skincare than sunscreen in my opinion and I will definitely repurchase.

Name: clear skin spf 30 face sunscreen

This is the only new product I've introduced. I believe it's the tocopheryl. :( * Very irritating * I need to wear sunscreen daily because of my acne products, but I've yet to find one that doesn't clog my pores even further. Seeing the overwhelmingly positive reviews, I bought this when it was on sale. Sadly, it doesn't live up to the hype. It was lightweight on my skin, but it smells like cheap body sunblock. And every time I used it I had a new zit forming by the end of the day, without changing anything else in my skin routine. I wanted this to work so badly, but it does the opposite of being good for acne prone skin. * I was going to give 4 stars because it has a Proactiv scent I'm not in love with, However 5 stars because it does a great job as an spf as well as clearing up your face at the same time. * Since I am using retinol, my dermatologist insists that I wear sunscreen.  I have struggled to find any spf sunscreen that my reactive sensitive oily acne-prone mature skin doesn't breakout to and react to.

This is my first facial sunscreen success.  This one is great!  Doesn't leave me greasy or overly shiny.  Doesn't irritate or break out my skin.  I only wish it was higher spf, but better spf 30 than nothing. * I have very oily skin and hate wearing SPF. I have trial and errored so many mositurizers and this is the best one. Doesn't feel greasy or heavy on my skin. Actually has cut down on me looking greasy throughout the day. Highly recommend! * I have purchased this sunscreen many times. It is the best sunscreen to use under makeup. It isn't greasy, doesn't pill and it doesn't break me out.

Not sure if I will continue to use as my spf after this is finished, also small amount and expensive to use every day. * It is a more than wonderful serum for oily skin. It makes the skin clear, fresh, hydrated and free of blemishes. Youthful, attractive and vibrant. It makes the skin like the skin of children. You should give it a try, followed by their amazing moisturizer! * Very good serum and it's a good price. I highly recommend it. I will continue to buy it. Don't rub it in too much, it will roll off on your skin. * I love the way it absorbs into my oily skin and gives me a matt finish. It's not greasy and it's not fragrant. It is wonderful for in the hot Alabama sun and damp winter. * I have combo skin that in summer humidity is extremely oily and acne prone. This product is the absolute best product I have ever used to control shine, including regular non SPF moisturizers. Normally, I have to blot my face a dozen times a day, no exaggeration, and with this I don't have to blot at all! Life changing! It works amazing under makeup and the sun protection lasts all day. This does not dry the skin and I used it alone without another moisturizer. I use this even when not going outside just for the matte finish. It does not cause acne either. LOVE it. Name: bright this way liquid sun shield spf 50
play 100% mineral lotion spf 50 with green algae
comments: * So, i guess mineral sunscreens just arent meant for me. I tried a bit on my hand in the store and was hopeful because it didnt leave a shiny grease spot on me, and i didnt notice the white pallor it left (dang tricky store lighting) but with the first face application, i could see i made a mistake. I am VERY fair to begin with and now i look like Casper with this lotion! Add to it the slight sting it causes and dry flaky skin the next day and this is just ALL bad. Only reason i gave 2 stars is because of the non-greasyness * I wanted to try something new for once. I put it on, it felt fine and looked fine. the next day I woke up and my face was flaky, red, and burning. I couldn't go anywhere for a few days not even to work! * I bought this sunscreen becuase i have heard good things about Supergoop! and becuase this is a mineral based sunscreen. I already knew that the zinc oxide in this gives a white cast, but I was not prepared how hard I had to rub my skin to get this slighlty blended into my skin. Would not purchase again * When I first tried it on my hand, I felt it rubbed in we'll so I was hopeful because it's so hard to find sunscreen for brown skin tones. But after using it fully on my face and arms, it started to pill when I had moisturizer, cream, or eczema ointment underneath. It was kind of like it turned to hard paste when trying to rub into skin because the consistency changed. It was pilling on my arms more because I put moisturizer beforehand. I put it on my face without moisturizer underneath and had a white cast for at least 4 hours until the natural oils on my face came in and flushed it out a bit. It's not for darker complexions. It has a chalky sunscreen smell. It's very pricey for sunscreen and I expected better. * I read a review on here that said this sunscreen leaves a white cast and I 100% attest to that. It's a pretty strong white cast that might work for a day at the beach but not for regular use. Hopefully Supergoop! can make a mineral sunscreen for darker complexions but for now I'll continue using their Play: Everyday Lotion SPF 30. * Wanted to like this because its 100% mineral but the white overcast on my complexion is too much for me to use. The regular Play lotion works better for me. * Love this as a mineral lotion option for sunscreen! Smells so good too!

Name: mineral sunscreen spf 30
comments:
* It is mineral, is not greasy, doesn´t leave a white cast BUT I preffer something more liquid, more light.
And it expensive considering the content. * this sunscreen is great. at first i was not a fan but as continued to use it i found that the pros outweighed the cons. what i love about it is that one pump goes a long way and it spreads nicely. i also love that it doesnt leave a white cast. i apply this on my facial hair and it dries clear. its pretty insane. i was gagged when it dried clear on my BEARED! i was sold after that. it also leaves the skin tacky and glowy, which i love. the only con is that its watery but i noticed that it allows the sunscreen to spread and glide across the skin nicley. like i said, a little goes a long way. i think for people with facial hair, its hard to reach the skin underneath, so i do use more than the avergave person. its a decent amount of product for the price but for people who need to use more, it can be just enough for like a month. nonethless, she did what needed to be done. * I usually don't write reviews but I had such a terrible experience with this product that I felt it was only fair to share my results because my skin looked the worst that it has ever looked in my life!!

I had been using Mario Badescu's Hydro Moisturizer w/ Vit C and my skin was looking great with no breakouts.  Unfortunately, that moisturizer doesn't have SPF in it so I decided to try this sunscreen.  My skin isn't sensitive, but it could not handle this sunscreen. I experienced terrible breakouts around my jawline (which has never happened before) and it took a long time for my skin to clear.

I am a fan of Mario B's products, just not this one… * This is the most misunderstood sunscreen. It is so beautiful and lightweight. The glow is so  amazing! It wears beautifully under makeup too! * has a white cast… * I am always looking for a good mineral sunscreen. The ladies at Ulta recommended this one -and they were right! 
Lightweight, blends easily, slight white cast when first applied (I expect that with a mineral formula) but after waiting the requisite 15 minutes-it has disappeared into my skin. 
Good price point too * I've finally found a sunscreen that works for me. Mineral sunscreen tends to leave a white cast, but I did not have that with this one. I can layer it on top of my serums and moisturizer with no pilling, and it extremely lightweight compared to what I've used in the past. I generally hate using sunscreen, too, but this one is so easy to use that I can see myself using it all year long (as we should be protecting our skin, even in the winter months). I'm also prone to acne and cysts, and I have yet to have a problem and I've been using this stuff since May.

Name: r&r sun elixir spf 30 glow oil
comments: * I really wanted to try an oil sunscreen but unfortunately my skin type did not like it. All the ingredients sounded attractive as skincare! I tried layering with moisturizer, or just a very lightweight serum or even with nothing underneath but my makeup would not stay put :( I did wear it on non-makeup days and even if it felt like it was there, I could tell my skin was hydrated and did not look oily at all. But what I really did not like, and this is personal taste, was the fragrance. It is a great fragrance for say a body lotion in my opinion but it lingered for the rest of the day and I did not enjoy it since it felt too strong. I would love all the skincare benefits without the fragrance, even it if it smells amazing! Overall, I'd say it is a great product if your skin loves oils (apparently mine does not :( ), and maybe if your face doesn't like it the skin on the rest of your body will! * This elixir is a perfect body glow that also protects you from the sun.  It is a bit too oily for my face but on my chest and shoulders its absolutely amazing.  Would highly recommend for the body. * I love this sunscren oil * I love the day serum and frequently use the night serum over that because I love the glow. I was using the sun serum over that to give the UV protection. Now I get the glow and the UV protection in one product. Win Win!! I also love the scent and the feel of the product on my skin. I love all of the Undefined products but this may be my new favorite. 😍 * I was lucky enough to test this innovative product before launch. Sun protection is a must for me and Sun Elixir is a game-changer. The unique oil formula glides on seamlessly, leaving no sticky or heavy residue behind. However, my favorite thing about Sun Elixir is its light floral fragrance. If I could, I'd bottle it up and wear it as perfume. With just a quick application as the last step in my routine, I'm ready to take on the day feeling effortlessly glowy and protected * Beautiful product. Glowing, hydrating and feels great in my mature dry skin! I'm so in love with this line. All of the products feel great and give me a pick me up! Love the sun serum tint. Hope for some undefined cream make up. * I started with the 1st Elixir that was made, and fell in love. The smell and oil made my dry face smooth and soft. When this sun Elixir was made I had to try it out, and I'm glad I did. The smell is AMAZING, and the way it hydrates my face and neck making it soft and smooth feeling, I'm in love AGAIN.. I'm a fan for life. I will definitely be buying more..
